ducalis: <entryFree id="n14835" type="main" key="du^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dux</etym>, <sense id="n14835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a leader</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commander</hi> (post-class.): tunicae, Valer. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a leader</hi> or <hi rend="ital">general</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antecedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ducator: <entryFree id="n14836" type="main" key="du^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ducatrix: <entryFree id="n14837" type="hapax" key="du^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ducator</etym>, <sense id="n14837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female leader</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum iracundia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ducatus: <entryFree id="n14838" type="main" key="du^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dux</etym>, <sense id="n14838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">military leadership</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">h(gemoni/a</foreign> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculis omnibus ducatum latrones ei deferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14838.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">guidance</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">caecus autem si caeco ducatum praestet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14838.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere a domino ducatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 7, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ducena: <entryFree id="n14839" type="main" key="du^ce_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>duceni</etym>, <sense id="n14839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a</hi> ducenarius, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 5.</sense></entryFree>
ducenarius: <entryFree id="n14840" type="main" key="du^ce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing two hundred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to two hundred</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: procuratores, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who received a salary of</hi> 200 sestertia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl> (cf. Dio Cass. 53, 15): <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3444</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 946</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2648</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducenarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: judices, <hi rend="ital">petty judges</hi> (chosen from persons possessed of 200 sestertia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭ-cēnārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the commander of</hi> 200 <hi rend="ital">men</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcē-nārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the office of a</hi> ducenarius, i. q. ducena, Cod. Th. 1, 9, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 190, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duceni: <entryFree id="n14841" type="main" key="du^ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n14841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ducenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 4</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two hundred each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two hundred</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:18" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 28</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
ducentesima: <entryFree id="n14842" type="main" key="du^cente_si^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcentēsĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars) [ducenti], <sense id="n14842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the two hundredth part</hi>, as a tax; <hi rend="ital">one half per cent.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ducenti: <entryFree id="n14843" type="main" key="du^centi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcenti</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<number>sing.</number> ducentum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <sense id="n14843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ducentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 37 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducentarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">-torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aq. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aq. 7</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">num.</hi> [duo-centum], <hi rend="ital">two hundred.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14843.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 27</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14843.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a large number</hi> (indefinite), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 9</bibl>; 1, 6, 42 al.</sense></entryFree>
ducenties: <entryFree id="n14844" type="main" key="du^centi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcentĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭens</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>ducenti</etym>, <sense id="n14844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two hundred times.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14844.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">many times</hi> indefinitely, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ducentum: <entryFree id="n14845" type="main" key="du^centum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcentum</orth>, v. ducenti.</entryFree>
ducianus: <entryFree id="n14846" type="main" key="du^ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dux</etym>, <sense id="n14846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a leader</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commander</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">officium, Cod. Th. 15, 11, 2: apparitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 11, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ducianus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a commander's servant</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 16, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duco: <entryFree id="n14847" type="main" key="du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n14847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> duc; <cit><quote lang="la">but duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 26</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Perf. sync.</hi>: duxti, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 283, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:91:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 91, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 27</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Goth. tiuh-an; O. H. Germ. zieh-an, to draw; Germ. -zog, in Herzog, commander, duke</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forward</hi>, in all senses; very freq. passing over into the signif. of the compounds abducere, deducere, adducere, producere, etc., and of the synonyms agere, trahere, movere, etc. (very freq.). </sense><sense id="n14847.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14847.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sequar? quo ducis nunc me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: duc hos intro, id. <cb n="DUCO" /> Am. 2, 2, 224; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duc ac demonstra mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas secum mulierculas sunt in castra ducturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(difficile iter) vix qua singuli carri ducerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: aquam ducere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 192</bibl> P.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aquam per fundum ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum per siccas fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aërem spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam spiritu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>; and in gen.: spiritum, for <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam et spiritum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura naribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to inhale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucos nectaris,</quote> <trans><tr>to drink in full draughts</tr>, <tr>to quaff</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 22</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucunda oblivia vitae (referring to the waters of Lethe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:714 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 714 sq.</bibl>) et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mucronem,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw from the scabbard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 378</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum vaginā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:929" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 929</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem vagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:342" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 342</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: ensem duxerat faber,</quote> <trans><tr>had beaten out</tr>, <tr>forged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, also transf. of that which is drawn by lot,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus aratri,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <trans><tr>to row</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:294" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 294</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:353" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 353</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosa brachia,</quote> <trans><tr>in dancing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanas,</quote> <trans><tr>to spin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <trans><tr>to milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:358" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena manu,</quote> <trans><tr>to guide</tr>, <tr>govern</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:518" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 518</bibl></cit>: vela, <hi rend="ital">to haul</hi> (= navigare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus, of swimming,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw the flanks together</tr>, <tr>become broken-winded</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw awry</tr>, <tr>to make wry faces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 101</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 774</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:41" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 41</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non equus impiger Curru ducet Achaico Victorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 93</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quisque ducere, trahere, rapere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take to one's self</tr>, <tr>appropriate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n14847.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, as a way or road: <cit><quote lang="la">via ducit (te), in urbem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 401</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:679" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 679</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brundisium Minuci melius via ducat an Appi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via ad undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via ad infernas sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:433" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 433</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:437" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 437</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:28:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 28, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 6:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14847.5" n="2" level="3"> Se, in colloq. lang., <hi rend="ital">to betake one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam me ad regem recta ducam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 7</bibl>: Balbus duxit se a Gadibus, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.6" n="3" level="3"> A legal t. t., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi> a person before court, to prison, to punishment, etc.: POST. DEINDE. MANVS. INIECTIO. ESTO. IN. IVS. DVCITO, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos duci in carcerem jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vincula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4, 3</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducite, ubi capiat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 65</bibl></cit>; Sen. de Ira, 1, 16, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97, 3 al.</bibl>: NI. IVDICATVM. FACIT. AVT. QVIS. ENDO. EM. IVRE. VINDICIT. SECVM. DVCITO. VINCITO, etc., XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta ejus modi: SI PETIT DUCAS. C. Fuficium duci jussit petitorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to be imprisoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>; so of a debtor (addictus) who is led off as a slave, Novat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prov.: stultitiast venatum ducere invitas canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14847.7" n="4" level="3"> Uxorem, <hi rend="ital">to lead a wife home</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to marry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona uxor si ea deducta est, etc. ... Verum egon eam ducam domum, Quae, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam Orgetorigis in matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum uxorem ducturum esse aliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem (or aliquam, filiam alicujus, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 69</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 21</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 110, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 10, 11</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu negaris ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4 al.</bibl>: jugum ducere cum infidelibus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be yoked</hi> in marriage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 6, 14</bibl>.—Rarely for nubere: si ignorans statum Erotis ut liberum duxisti, isque<cb n="DUCO" />  postea servus est judicatus, etc., Imp. Antonin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 18, 3</bibl>.—In the comic poets, of taking home prostitutes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 10</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14847.8" n="5" level="3"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n14847.9" n="a" level="4"> Said of a commander, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to march</hi> his army in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">locis apertis exercitum ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 68, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ab Allobrogibus in Segusianos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in fines Suessionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 38, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 18, 1: exercitum (legiones, etc.) in Bellovacos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; 5, 24, 2 et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ad eam partem munitionum, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 62, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Uticam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas copias contra Labienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, of the soldiers, <hi rend="ital">to march</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam in partem aut quo consilio ducerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 2</bibl></cit>.—And in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, of the general himself, <hi rend="ital">to march</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi> (a favorite expression of Liv.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Caes. or Sall.): (Mettus) ducit, quam proxime ad hostem potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 35</bibl>; 22, 18 et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n14847.10" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> an army or (more freq.) a division: <cit><quote lang="la">qua in legatione duxit exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui superiore anno primum pilum duxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:91:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 91, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; 3, 104, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem exercitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—Rarely, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> a division <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine sua Caesar sex legiones expeditas ducebat: post eas ... inde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; hence also, <hi rend="ital">to march in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take the lead</hi>, said of the division that forms the van: <cit><quote lang="la">pars equitum et auxiliariae cohortes ducebant, mox prima legio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 64</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n14847.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit etiam, quod familiam ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Manut.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem (discipulorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:668" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 668</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14847.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To conduct</hi> as prisoners in a triumph: <cit><quote lang="la">per triumphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 45, § 139</bibl></cit>, v. triumphus.—</sense><sense id="n14847.13" n="6" level="3"> With the accessory idea of creation, formation, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">struo, pono, condo, fundo): parietem per vestibulum alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to erect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum ex castris ad aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres de terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivos vultus de marmore (with excudere spirantia aera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 849</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 634</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 240</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 283, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 18</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:237" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 237</bibl>; hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also: <cit><quote lang="la">epos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:12:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 63</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">liniam ex colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring forth by clysters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl> et saep.: alapam alicui, qs. <hi rend="ital">to fetch one a box on the ear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 3, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">colaphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 83</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. of processions, dances, etc.: funus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 746</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 256</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:405" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 699</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">choros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 6</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">choreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 582</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 520</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.14" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> any thing (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cicatricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situm,</quote> <trans><tr>to grow rusty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:485" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 485</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pallorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to grow pale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:760" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 59</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n14847.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14847.16" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">progredimur quo ducit quemque voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 258</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad strepitum citharae cessatum ducere curam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber vota bonos ducit ad exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 8, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quaedam parva sane ducant (futurum oratorem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:58" default="NO">1, 5, 58</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ducunt volentem fata, nolentem trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 107" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.17" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14847.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deduce</hi>, <pb n="616" /> <cb n="DUCO" /> <hi rend="ital">derive</hi> its origin or beginning from, any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliqua re totius vitae ducere exordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exordium a nostra persona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:7" default="NO">4, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium disputationis a principe investigandae veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli initium a fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">initia causasque omnium ex quatuor temporum mutationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">originem ab Isocrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:38" default="NO">1, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressionem non ex oratoriis disputationibus, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum ab iis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ex quo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 11, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen a Graeco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:1" default="NO">3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 66</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: utrumque (sc. amor et amicitia) ductum (al. dictum) est ab amando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi> a person, as regards his will or opinions, in any direction; <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">induce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi>, in a good or bad sense (most freq. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ita me ad credendum tua ducit oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ducit scholarum consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO">5, 11, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducit te species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">declamatores quosdam perversa ducit ambitio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis statuarum honore aut gloria ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestu et lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc errore ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris eorum et urbanitate, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes trahimur et ducimur ad cognitionis et scientiae cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14847.20" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ph. 3, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl> (3, 8, 1 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 587</bibl> (with decipere).—</sense><sense id="n14847.21" n="3" level="3"> With regard to time, <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37, 5</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 42, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum in hiemem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam rem longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem prope in noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit> et saep. Also transf., of time itself: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem ex die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; and of persons who are <hi rend="ital">put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delayed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi se diutius duci intellexit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), </sense><sense id="n14847.22" n="b" level="4"> In gen., of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem in litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 641</bibl> (where, shortly before, vitam <hi rend="ital">producere</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 560</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.23" n="4" level="3"> In mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">to calculate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>: age nunc summam sumptus duc, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 283, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum ut sequamur, quoniam XC. medimnūm milia duximus, accedant eo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl> and 16; 6, 2, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.24" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the mercant. sphere. </sense><sense id="n14847.25" n="(a)" level="5"> Rationem alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for one's advantage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interest</hi> (a favorite expression of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">duxi meam rationem, quam tibi facile me probaturum arbitrabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit> D, § 7; so, <cit><quote lang="la">suam quoque rationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to have respect to one's own advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">non minorem aratorum quam populi rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis meae rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem officii, non commodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius cujusque temporis ducta ratio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem officii atque existimationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14847.26" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem as</hi> any thing (cf. aestimo and existimo; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. in prose and poetry): parvi id ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro nihilo aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pro falsis ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiam pro malevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos eritis judices, Laudin' an vitio duci id factum oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid honori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid laudi, Nep. praef. § 4: aliquem despicatui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: nihil praeter virtutem in bonis ducere (for which, shortly after, in bonis <hi rend="ital">habere</hi> = numerare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in numero hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 23, 8</bibl>; without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 21, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem loco affinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 1</bibl></cit> Kritz. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cb n="DUCT" /> aliquid testimonii loco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelae nostrae duximus, cum Africo bello urgerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">officii duxit exorare filiae patrem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faceret, quod e republica fideque sua duceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">malum cum amici tuum ducis malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Archytas iracundiam seditionem quandam animi vere ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum, quos idoneos ducebat, consilium habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil rectum nisi quod placuit sibi ducunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 83</bibl></cit>.— With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic equidem ducebam animo rebarque futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia tua in te posita esse ducas humanosque casus virtute inferiores putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38</bibl>; 3, 9 (three times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 59, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 18</bibl> et saep.—Here too probably belongs the much disputed passage: ludos et inania honoris medio rationis atque abundantiae duxit (= <hi rend="ital">ludos</hi> publicos cum aliis rebus quae ad inania honoris pertinent, duxit, i. e. existimavit habendos et ponendos in <hi rend="ital">medio rationis</hi> atque abundantiae, ut inter rationem, quae plane spernit inania, et abundantiam, quae eadem ostentat, media via incederet), <hi rend="ital">he thought right to manage them in a middle course between reason and profusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, v. Dübner and Orell. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
ductabilitas: <entryFree id="n14848" type="hapax" key="ducta_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ducto</etym>, <sense id="n14848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aptness to be duped</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ductarius: <entryFree id="n14849" type="main" key="ducta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for drawing</hi>: funis, perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3</bibl> and 5.</sense></entryFree>
ductilis: <entryFree id="n14850" type="main" key="ducti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duco</etym>, <sense id="n14850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be led</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guided</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conducted</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">scena,</quote> <trans><tr>movable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen aquae riguae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a canal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:31:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that may be hammered out thin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ductim: <entryFree id="n14851" type="main" key="ductim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by drawing</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">major pars operis in vinea ductim, potius quam caesim faciendaest (for which, shortly after: ductu falcis, non ictu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invergere in me liquores,</quote> <trans><tr>in good draughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit> (cf.: pocula <hi rend="ital">duces</hi> Lesbii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 21</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ductio: <entryFree id="n14852" type="main" key="ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leading off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not anteAug.): aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 24</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ducere quis posset eos in quos habet jus ductionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:30:3:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 30, 3, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ductito: <entryFree id="n14853" type="main" key="ducti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lead with one</hi> (a Plautin. word). </sense><sense id="n14853.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n14853.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14853.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to lead home</hi> a wife, <hi rend="ital">to marry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14853.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego follitim ductitabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ducto: <entryFree id="n14854" type="main" key="ducto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ducto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> (very freq. in Plaut.; elsewh. perh. only in Ter., Sall., and once in Tac.; not in Cic., Caes., or the Aug. authors). </sense><sense id="n14854.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14854.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restim ductans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum per saltuosa loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 70, 2</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 100</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equites in exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 11</bibl> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 44</bibl>, this phraseology was regarded by many as indelicate, prob. on account of the foll. signif. of the word ducto).—</sense><sense id="n14854.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: aliquam, <hi rend="ital">to take home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take to one's self</hi> a concubine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14854.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14854.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil moror ductarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me ductavit dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14854.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi>: set me Apollo ipsus delectat ductat Delficus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 32</bibl> (Trag. v. 390 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">meretrices eum labiis ductant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—(But in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 85</bibl>, the correct reading is duco, not ducto, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
ductor: <entryFree id="n14855" type="main" key="ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi> (class.; a favorite word of Vergil, used by him more than 20 times; cf.: dux, imperator, princeps, praetor, praefectus, etc.): exercitus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <trans><tr>a guide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 21</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">129</bibl> et saep.; cf. apum (in their battles), id. G. <cb n="DUEL" /> 4, 88; <cit><quote lang="la">of the leaders in warlike games,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <trans><tr>a pilot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 334</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 574</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum Tibris,</quote> <trans><tr>the king of rivers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 112</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14855.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who extends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draws out</hi>: ferreus, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">iron - worker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 32, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 10, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ductrix: <entryFree id="n14856" type="main" key="ductrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ductor</etym>, <sense id="n14856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a general</hi>: Penthesilea, Dar. Phryg. 36.</sense></entryFree>
ductus: <entryFree id="n14857" type="main" key="ductus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from duco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14858" type="main" key="ductus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ductus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duco</etym>, <sense id="n14858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conducting</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n14858.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14858.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; cf. the work of Frontinus: De aquaeductibus; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense also simply ductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequali ductu porticus,</quote> <trans><tr>a line</tr>, <tr>row</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <trans><tr>form</tr>, <tr>shape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:2" default="NO">10, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris (with vultus),</quote> <trans><tr>lineaments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liniarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14858.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">military lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generalship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:115" default="NO">115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. connected with auspicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 563 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">sometimes also opp. to auspicium, as the supreme command,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n14858.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse. </sense><sense id="n14858.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi> of a play, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14858.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A period</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 30</bibl> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
dudum: <entryFree id="n14859" type="main" key="du_dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūdum</orth>, <sense id="n14859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. temp.</hi> [diu-dum, it is some time since; cf. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1018</bibl> P. Hence]. </sense><sense id="n14859.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A short time ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little while ago</hi> (in Plaut. and Ter. freq., and repeatedly in Cicero's philos. writings and letters, and in Vergil; elsewh., except in the compound jamdudum, very rare; not in Caes.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also diu, pridem): quid ille revortitur, qui dudum properare se aibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 231</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 73</bibl>; 3, 2, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 29</bibl> et saep.; Ter And. 3, 4, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 34</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 262</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 650</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:670" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 670</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14859.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14859.3" n="a" level="4"> Opp. nunc: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc assentatrix scelesta est, dudum adversatrix erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si dudum fuerat ambiguom hoc mihi, nunc non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 26 al.</bibl></cit>;
