<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 726</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 632</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14859.4" n="b" level="4"> Opp. nunc demum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 78</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 3, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14859.5" n="c" level="4"> Without such oppos. particles, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 5, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:252" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 599</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu me sic salutas, quasi dudum non videris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit> (dub. Ussing ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n14859.6" n="C" level="2"> In Plaut. connected with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, to denote immediately past or present time, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ut dudum hinc abii, accessi ad adolescentes in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet qui dudum tecum venit, cum pallam mihi Detulisti,</quote> <trans><tr>just now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl>.—Less freq. without these conjunctions: <cit><quote lang="la">is se ad portum dixerat Ire dudum,</quote> <trans><tr>just now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 135</bibl></cit>, ed. Ritschl.—</sense><sense id="n14859.7" n="II" level="1"> To designate a remoter past, only in two combinations. </sense><sense id="n14859.8" n="1" level="3"> Haud dudum, <hi rend="ital">not long ago</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">just now</hi>, = modo: <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> E Persia ad me allatae modo sunt istae, a meo domino. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Quando? <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Haud dudum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14859.9" n="2" level="3"> Quam dudum, <hi rend="ital">how long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide quam dudum hic asto et pulto!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 30</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Qui non abiisti, ita ut dudum dixeras? <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Dudum? Quam dudum istuc factum'st? <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Temptas; <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum, modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duella: <entryFree id="n14860" type="main" key="du^ella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>duo</etym>, <sense id="n14860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman weight</hi> = two sextulae, or <hi rend="ital">the third part of an</hi> uncia, Rhemn. Fann. de Pond. 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 16, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duellator: <entryFree id="n14861" type="main" key="du^ella_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭellātor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dŭellĭcus</orth>, v. bell.</entryFree>
duellis: <entryFree id="n14862" type="hapax" key="du^ellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭellis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duellum = bellum</etym>, <sense id="n14862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warrior</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duellius: <entryFree id="n14863" type="main" key="Du^elli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŭellĭus</orth> (in MSS. and inscrr. also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŭīlius</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Duillius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>duellum = bellum; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 15</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n14863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman gens;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n14863.1" n="1" level="3"> C., <hi rend="ital">the famous conqueror of the Carthaginians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in honor of whom the</hi> Columna rostrata <hi rend="ital">was erected</hi>, 493 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25</bibl>; <pb n="617" /> <cb n="DULC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:665" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 665</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 549</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14863.2" n="2" level="3"> M., <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, A. U. C. 283, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
duellona: <entryFree id="n14864" type="main" key="Du^ello_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŭellōna</orth>, v. Bellona.</entryFree>
duellum: <entryFree id="n14865" type="main" key="du^ellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭellum</orth>, v. bellum.</entryFree>
duicensus: <entryFree id="n14866" type="gloss" key="du^i^census"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭĭcensus</orth> <itype>dicebatur cum altero, id est, cum filio census</itype>, Paul. ex. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66, 14</bibl> Müll. [duis = bis and censeo].</entryFree>
duidens: <entryFree id="n14867" type="gloss" key="duidens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">duidens</orth>, v. bidens, II. b.</entryFree>
duilius: <entryFree id="n14868" type="main" key="Du^i_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŭīlĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŭillĭus</orth>, v. Duellius.</entryFree>
duim: <entryFree id="n14869" type="main" key="du^im"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭim</orth>, v. do <sense id="n14869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duis: <entryFree id="n14870" type="main" key="du^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭis</orth>, <sense id="n14870.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">verb.</hi>, v. do <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n14870.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Num.</hi>, v. bis <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duitae: <entryFree id="n14871" type="main" key="du^i_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duo</etym>, <sense id="n14871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heretics who believed in two gods</hi>, Prud. Hamart. praef. 37.</sense></entryFree>
duitas: <entryFree id="n14872" type="main" key="du^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state of being two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 242, § 3</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">dua/s</foreign>, duitas, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
duitor: <entryFree id="n14873" type="main" key="dui^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">duĭtor</orth>, v. do <sense id="n14873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dulcacidus: <entryFree id="n14874" type="main" key="dulca^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcăcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcis-acidus</etym>, <sense id="n14874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a sourish-sweet flavor</hi> (late Lat.): liquor, Seren. Sammon. 11, 151; 32, 607.</sense></entryFree>
dulcator: <entryFree id="n14875" type="hapax" key="dulca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dulco</etym>, <sense id="n14875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweetener</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontis amari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 237</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dulce: <entryFree id="n14876" type="main" key="dulce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>, v. dulcis, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14876.1" n="(b)" level="5">.</sense></entryFree>
dulcedo: <entryFree id="n14877" type="main" key="dulce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dulcis</etym>, <sense id="n14877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14877.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sweet taste</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">radix amara cum quadam dulcedine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 25</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n14877.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1266</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum et vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut aliquem fructum capiant dulcedinis almae (shortly before opp. dolor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 971</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 412</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 55</bibl>: honoris et pecuniae, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 2</bibl>: avium (<hi rend="ital">genit. obj.</hi>), Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrariae legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 538</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">plebeios creandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praedandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:222 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 222 al.</bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dulcesco: <entryFree id="n14878" type="main" key="dulcesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcesco</orth>, <itype>dulcui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to become sweet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:70" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 7, 41, § 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 17, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcia: <entryFree id="n14879" type="main" key="dulci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. dulcis, I. B.</entryFree>
dulciarius: <entryFree id="n14880" type="main" key="dulci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcia</etym>, <sense id="n14880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of confections</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making sweetmeats</hi>: vascula, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> confections, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14880.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">pistor,</quote> <trans><tr>a confectioner</tr>, <tr>pastry-cook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:222" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 222</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244, 30</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dulciari-us</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pastry-cook</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 27</bibl>; Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulciculus: <entryFree id="n14881" type="main" key="dulci^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [dulcis], <hi rend="ital">sweetish</hi> (very rare): potio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 46</bibl>; caseus, as a term of endearment, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcifer: <entryFree id="n14882" type="main" key="dulci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ērum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcis-fero</etym>, <sense id="n14882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing sweetness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweet</hi> (very rare): ficus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 103</bibl> P. (v. 71 Vahl.): cantharus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcifico: <entryFree id="n14883" type="main" key="dulci^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dulcis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n14883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweeten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio jejunium dulcificat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. Dub. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dulciloquus: <entryFree id="n14884" type="main" key="dulci^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcis-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n14884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetly speaking</hi> (late Lat. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars Orphei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcimodus: <entryFree id="n14885" type="main" key="dulci^mo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭ-mŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcis</etym>, <sense id="n14885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetly modulated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">psalmi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 664</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcinervis: <entryFree id="n14886" type="main" key="dulci^nervis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭnervis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcis-nervus</etym>, <sense id="n14886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetly-stringed</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Capt. 9:section=917" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Capt. 9, § 917</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dulciola: <entryFree id="n14887" type="hapax" key="dulci^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dulcis</etym>, <sense id="n14887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little sugar-cakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 115, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dulciorelocus: <entryFree id="n14888" type="hapax" key="dulci^o_re^lo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭōrĕlŏcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcisos-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n14888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking with a sweet mouth</hi>, an epithet of Nestor, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcis: <entryFree id="n14889" type="main" key="dulcis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from gulcis, by dissimilation; cf. ten-ebrae from root <hi rend="ital">tam-;</hi> root in Sanscr. gul-jam, sweetness; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gluku/s, glukero/s</foreign>, sweet</etym>, <sense id="n14889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweet</hi> (very freq.; cf.: <cb n="DULG" /> suavis, venustus, jucundus, gratus, acceptus, amoenus, etc.). </sense><sense id="n14889.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, opp. amarus: <cit><quote lang="la">(animal) sentit et dulcia et amara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Asin. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 20</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 938</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 890</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1377</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 795</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 20, § 92</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n14889.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> and heterocl., <orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">sweet cakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honey-cakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sugar-cakes</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 429</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14889.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14889.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcia atque amara apud te sum elocutus omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:997" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 997</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:989" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 989</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacia, vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of orators or writers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:73" default="NO">73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:44" default="NO">12, 10, 44</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: non quo ea (oratione) Laelii quicquam sit dulcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 99</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditu nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 37, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce et decorum est pro patria mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae dulcis herili canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:130" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 130</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce etiam fugias, fieri quod amarum potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:144" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 144</bibl></cit> Rib. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in amicissimo quoque dulcissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n14889.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. of friends, lovers, etc., <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici (opp. acerbi inimici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia remissior esse debet et liberior et dulcior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:40" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 23, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 8</bibl>.—Hence, in addressing a person: <cit><quote lang="la">optime et dulcissime frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcissime Attice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: mi dulcissime <bibl default="NO"><author>Tiro</author>, Cic. Fil. Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis amice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce decus meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agis, dulcissime rerum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightfully.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14889.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭter</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:62" default="NO">4, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:14" default="NO">9, 4, 14</bibl>; 12, 10, 71. —</sense><sense id="n14889.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dulce</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 51, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 274</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14889.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcius spirare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14889.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcissime scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcisonorus: <entryFree id="n14890" type="main" key="dulci^so^no_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭsŏnōrus</orth>, <itype>a, am</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcissonorus</etym>, <sense id="n14890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetly sounding</hi>: res <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 24</bibl> Santen. (p. 467, 17 Keil).</sense></entryFree>
dulcisonus: <entryFree id="n14891" type="main" key="dulci^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dulcis-sonus</etym>, <sense id="n14891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetly sounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 6, 5</bibl></cit>; Cassiod. in Psalt. praef.</sense></entryFree>
dulcitas: <entryFree id="n14892" type="main" key="dulci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dulcis</etym>, <sense id="n14892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness</hi> (ante- and post-classical). </sense><sense id="n14892.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: fici, App. de Mundo, 74, 34.—</sense><sense id="n14892.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: conspirantis animae, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 27</bibl> (Trag. v. 640 Rib.): tanta, Caecil. ap. Non. ib. (Com. v. 218 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
dulciter: <entryFree id="n14893" type="main" key="dulci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. dulcis, <sense id="n14893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14893.1" n="(a)" level="5">.</sense></entryFree>
dulcitudo: <entryFree id="n14894" type="main" key="dulci^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dulcis</etym>, <sense id="n14894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14894.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustatus, qui dulcitudine praeter ceteros sensus commovetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14894.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:8:10:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 8, 10, § 10</bibl></cit>: CVM QVA VIXIT ANNIS XIII. CVM MAGNA DVLCITVDINE, <hi rend="ital">in great tenderness</hi> (acc. to dulcis, II. B.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 752, 3</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 250, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulco: <entryFree id="n14895" type="main" key="dulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulco</orth>, <itype>ātus, āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweeten</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 2, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulcor: <entryFree id="n14896" type="main" key="dulcor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetness</hi> (cf. the opp. amaror; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1</bibl></cit>. 6; 3, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 11, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dulcoro: <entryFree id="n14897" type="main" key="dulco_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcōro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dulcor</etym>, <sense id="n14897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweeten</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">amaritudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 69, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 27, 9</bibl></cit>: mare mortuum et amaras aquas, Hier. ap. Psa. 76.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dulcōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">sweetened</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dulgibini: <entryFree id="n14898" type="main" key="Dulgi^bi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dulgĭbīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*doulgou/mnioi</foreign>), Ptol., <sense id="n14898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic tribe on the banks of the Weser</hi>, in the present Lippe - Detmold, Paderborn, and Pyrmont, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl>. <cb n="DUM" /></sense></entryFree>
dulice: <entryFree id="n14899" type="greek" key="du_li^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūlĭce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">doulikw=s</foreign>, <sense id="n14899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the manner of a slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servilely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulichium: <entryFree id="n14900" type="main" key="Du_li^chi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūlĭchĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*douli/xion</foreign> Hom., <foreign lang="greek">*doli/xai</foreign> Strab.), <sense id="n14900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ionian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">southeast of Ithaca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the kingdom of Ulysses</hi>, perhaps one of the Echinades, but its situation is uncertain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 67</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūlĭ-chĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. insula), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl> (3, 6, 4 M.).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n14900.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūlĭchĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Dulichium</hi>, or <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of Ulysses.</hi>— <cit><quote lang="la">So, dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 226</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 272</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21, 13</bibl></cit> (3, 14, 13 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <trans><tr>the head of Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:711" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Irus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 4, 17 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the companions of Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Penelope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dulorestes: <entryFree id="n14901" type="main" key="Du_lo^restes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūlŏrestes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Dolorestes</orth>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a tragedy of Pacuvius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 668</bibl> P. v. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 91 sq.</bibl> and 364.</sense></entryFree>
dum: <entryFree id="n14902" type="main" key="dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dum</orth>, <sense id="n14902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [for dium, acc. from dius; cf. diu, Corss. Ausspr. 2, 856], denotes the temporal relation of two actions to cach other, </sense><sense id="n14902.1" n="I" level="1"> As contemporaneous, or, </sense><sense id="n14902.2" n="II" level="1"> As in immediate succession, so that with the commencement of one action the other ceases. </sense><sense id="n14902.3" n="I" level="1"> As contemporaneous. </sense><sense id="n14902.4" n="A" level="2"> Without respect to the limits of the two actions, <hi rend="ital">while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whilst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during the time in which.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14902.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., construed with the indicative, except in <hi rend="ital">oratio obliqua</hi>, where the subjunctive was sometimes used. In Aug. poets and late prose the subjunctive often stands in <hi rend="ital">oratio directa</hi>, v. the following). </sense><sense id="n14902.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Indic. praes.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum cum hac usuraria Uxore mihi nunc morigero, haec curata sint Fac sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 190</bibl> et saep.— In the <hi rend="ital">praes. histor.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec loquimur, interea loci ad macellum ubi advenimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caec. 17:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caec. 17, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec geruntur, Caesari nuntiatum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">these forms of transition,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; 4, 32, 1; 4, 34, 3; 5, 22, 1; 6, 7, 1; 7, 57, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 56, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 1</bibl> et saep. dum ea conquiruntur et conferuntur, nocte intermissa circiter hominum milia VI ad Rhenum contenderunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 559</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec in Appulia gerebantur, Samnites ... urbem non tenuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:14" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum is in aliis rebus erat occupatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>—In the <hi rend="ital">fut.;</hi> nunc animum advortite Dum argumentum hujus eloquar comoediae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 96</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum Cyri et Alexandri similis esse voluit, Crassorum inventus est dissimillimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:292" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 292</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 2 al.</bibl>—In the <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in unam partem oculos animosque hostium certamen averterat, pluribus locis scalis capitur murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 24</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ingens geret Italia... Tertia dum Latio regnantem viderit aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 265</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum loqueris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>this instant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">oratio obliqua</hi>: dic, hospes, Spartae, nos te hic vidisse jacentes, Dum sanctis patriae legibus obsequimur, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 776</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14902.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi> In <hi rend="ital">oratio obliqua</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixisti, dum Planci in me meritum verbis extollerem, me arcem facere e cloaca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—In <hi rend="ital">oratio recta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o quotiens ausae, caneret dum valle sub alta, Rumpere mugitu carmina docta boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum intentus in eum se rex totus averteret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ea in Samnio gererentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Hisp. 23" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Hisp. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 12 al" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14902.8" n="b" level="4"> When the principal action is an immediate and sudden sequence of that described in <pb n="618" /> <cb n="DUM" /> the clause with dum, subito or repente is often used in the principal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tempus teritur, repente milites, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: dum advenientes filia interrogat, repente in osculis, etc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum Appium orno, subito sum factus accusatoris ejus socer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 61" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14902.9" n="c" level="4"> When the actions are simply presented as contemporaneous, interea, jam or interea jam is often used in the principal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec mecum reputo, accersitur lavatum interea virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ea Romani parant, jam Saguntum oppugnabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: dum ... interim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 7 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n14902.10" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of duration in the present, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14902.11" n="a" level="4"> In combination with etiam primum, and esp. freq. with the negations non, nec, ne, haud, nihil, nullus, nemo, v. h vv.—</sense><sense id="n14902.12" n="b" level="4"> Colloq., as an enclitic with imperatives and interjections (by some separately written ades dum, abi dum, etc, but v. Ritschl, Opusc Phil p. 567 sq.), orig, <hi rend="ital">acc</hi> of time, <hi rend="ital">a moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a second</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi> Sosia adesdum, paucis te volo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> And 1, 1, 2</bibl> abidum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 8</bibl> circumspicedum, Plaut Trin. 1, 2, 109: <cit><quote lang="la">dicdum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Hec 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit> facitodum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heaut 3, 2, 39</bibl> iteradum, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 14</bibl> jubedum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tangedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 5 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum (most freq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 1</bibl> et saep. (for which, agidum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 89</bibl> Ritschl ad loc.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 16 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:126 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 126 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62</bibl></cit> Drak.; 5, 52; 7, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ehodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 68</bibl>; also in Plaut. in enumerations: primumdum (= Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prw=ton me/n</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 61 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14902.13" n="B" level="2"> With respect to the temporal limit of both actions, i. q. tamdiu quam or usque eo, <hi rend="ital">as long as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14902.14" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> when the duration of the action in the principal clause is alone implied, except in the oratio obliqua).—In <hi rend="ital">praes.</hi>: bene factum a vobis, dum vivitis, non abscedet, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—In <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>: quid illos opinamini animi habuisse atque habituros, dum vivent? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:13:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 13, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:607 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 607 sq.</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14902.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi>, often, when the clause with <hi rend="ital">dum</hi> expresses a desired end, or refers to an indefinite future: <cit><quote lang="la">non tibi venit in mentem, Si, dum vivas, tibi bene facias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars, dum vires suppeterent, eruptionem censebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sua sponte, dum sine periculo liceret, excederet Gadibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc unum esse tempus de pace agendi, dum sibi uterque confideret ut pares ambo viderentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo (sc. animo) dum disputarem, tuam mihi dari vellem, Cotta, eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 147</bibl></cit> Bait. (v. Roby, Gram. 2, 284 sq.). —</sense><sense id="n14902.16" n="b" level="4"> With tamdiu, tantum, tantummodo, tantisper, usque; or opp. postea, postquam, deinde, ubi, nunc, etc.—With <hi rend="ital">tamdiu</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 5 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">tantum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 42</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">tantummodo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">tantisper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 54</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">usque</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5</bibl>: dum ... <hi rend="ital">postea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>—dum ... <hi rend="ital">postea quam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:82:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 82, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—dum ... <hi rend="ital">postquam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 27</bibl>—dum ... <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 42, 13</bibl>—dum ... <hi rend="ital">sed ubi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 51, 5</bibl>—dum ... <hi rend="ital">nunc</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 11</bibl>.—For tamdiu ... dum, less freq. dum ... dum, <hi rend="ital">as long as ... so long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic virgo dum intacta manet, dum cara suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 45</bibl></cit> and 56; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum habeat, dum amet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit> (al. tum).—</sense><sense id="n14902.17" n="c" level="4"> In Plautus repeatedly with an emphatic quidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14902.18" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14902.19" n="a" level="4"> In <cb n="DUM" /> conditional relations as a restrictive particle, like quatenus and duntaxat, <hi rend="ital">so long as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if so be that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provided that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if only</hi> (so regularly connected with the subjunctive; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in prose and poetry): dum pereas, nihil interduo aiant vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Concede, inspiciam quid sit scriptum. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Maxime, Tuo arbitratu, dum auferam abs te id quod peto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 58</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum res maneant, verba fingant arbitratu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: oderint, dum metuant, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet lascivire, dum nihil metuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.; in the <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sese in cruciatum dari cuperet, dum de patris morte quaereretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 68, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 33</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">An.</hi> Non pudet vanitatis? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Minime, dum ob rem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without a verb,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:58" default="NO">9, 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:5" default="NO">10, 3, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum eatenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14902.20" n="(b)" level="5"> With an emphatic modo, and often in one word, dummodo: <cit><quote lang="la">aeque istuc facio dummodo Eam des, quae sit quaestuosa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17, 17</bibl> (4, 16, 17 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:242 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 242 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem jejunitatem ... dummodo sit polita, dum urbana, dum elegans, in Attico genere ponit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dummodo sit dives, barbarus ille placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 276</bibl></cit>.—Separated by other words: <cit><quote lang="la">mea nil refert, dum patiar modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certumst pati, dum illum modo habeam mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:265" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 265</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14902.21" n="(g)" level="5"> With tamen, and, in Plautus (cf. above, 1. c.), with quidem.—With <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:7" default="NO">2, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> prooem. § 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:22:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 22, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quidem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; cf. the foll. number.—</sense><sense id="n14902.22" n="(d)" level="5"> In negative conditional clauses, with ne, <hi rend="ital">so long as not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provided that not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if only not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VTEI. SENATVS. NOSTER. DECERNERET. DVM. NE. MINVS. SENATORIBVS. C. ADESENT., S. C. de Bac. (thrice): id faciat saepe, dum ne lassus fiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 137</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>, B <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 21</bibl> Drak.; 28, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 81</bibl>.—So too, dummodo ne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 45 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum quidem ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14902.23" n="b" level="4"> With a causal accessory notion, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long enough for</hi>, etc (very rare, only with subjunctive) obsidio deinde per paucos dies magis quam oppugnatio fuit, dum vulnus ducis curaretur, Liv 21, 8; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 24, 40</bibl>; Suet <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:78" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> nam se quoque moveri finget, dum aditum sibi ad aures faciat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 46</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n14902.24" n="II" level="1"> In immediate suceession, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until that</hi> (with the subjunctive or the indicative, as the idea of aim or simply of time predominates; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">e.g.: quid dicam, quantus amor bestiarum sit in educandis custodiendisque iis, quae procreaverunt, usque ad eum finem, dum possint se ipsa defendere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea mansit in condicione atque pacto usque ad eum finem, dum judices rejecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 42</bibl>. Cicero generally, Caesar always employs the subjunctive). </sense><sense id="n14902.25" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is dum veniat, sedens ibi opperibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper mane, dum edormiscat unum somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 303</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">with morari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:28" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 38 al.</bibl>; cf. infra, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic deinceps omne opus contexitur, dum justa muri altitudo expleatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 58, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa quoque et bello passus, dum conderet urbem Inferretque deos Latio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut spatium intercedere posset, dum milites convenirent, legatis respondit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: Caesar ex eo tempore, dum ad flumen Varum veniatur, se frumentum daturum pollicetur, <hi rend="ital">from that time until</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 87, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">differant in tempus aliud, dum defervescat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 78</bibl></cit> (cf. ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum se ipsi colligant): quippe qui moram temporis quaererent, dum Hannibal in Africam traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.— <cb n="DUMT" /> </sense><sense id="n14902.26" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu hic nos, dum eximus, interea opperibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with opperiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with manere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 126</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with morari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causas innecte morandi, Dum pelago desaevit hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retine, dum ego huc servos evoco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tityre, dum redeo, pasce capellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: struppis, quibus lectica deligata erat, usque adeo verberari jussit, dum animam efflavit, Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 45</bibl>; in the <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 14, 14</bibl>. See Hand, Turs. II. pp. 303-330.</sense></entryFree>
dumalis: <entryFree id="n14903" type="hapax" key="du_ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dumus</etym>, <sense id="n14903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bushy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 329</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dumecta: <entryFree id="n14904" type="gloss" key="du_mecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūmecta</orth>, v. dumetum <sense id="n14904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dumesco: <entryFree id="n14905" type="gloss" key="du_mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūmesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> <etym>dumus</etym>, <sense id="n14905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be overgrown with bushes</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 335</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
