dumetum: <entryFree id="n14906" type="main" key="du_me_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūmētum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dummetum</orth> (another form: DUMECTA antiqui quasi DUMICETA appellabant, quae nos <sense id="n14906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dumeta</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=67:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 67, 10</bibl> Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">thorn-bushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorn-hedge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thicket.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14906.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 23 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14906.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur orationem tantas in angustias et Stoicorum dumeta compellimus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum efficere voltis (i. e. deum significare) in dumeta conrepitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dumicola: <entryFree id="n14907" type="hapax" key="du_mi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūmĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, m. [dumus-colo], <sense id="n14907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that dwells in thickets</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 895</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dummodo: <entryFree id="n14908" type="main" key="dummo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dummŏdo</orth>, v. dum, I. B. 2. a. <sense id="n14908.0" n="(b)" level="5">.</sense></entryFree>
dumnorix: <entryFree id="n14909" type="main" key="Dumno^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dumnŏrix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Aeduan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Divitiacus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dumosus: <entryFree id="n14910" type="main" key="du_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūmōsus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dummosus</orth>; old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dusmōsus</orth>, <itype>like Casmena, Casmili</itype>, etc., Liv. Andron. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=67:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 67, 5</bibl> Müll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dumus</etym>, <sense id="n14910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of thornbushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bushy</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">colles, id. Poët. 10, 150: arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 180</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dumtaxat: <entryFree id="n14911" type="main" key="dumtaxat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dumtaxat</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">duntax-at</orth>; in ante-Aug. monuments perh. always written separately; often in inscriptions separated by some words: dum ... taxat; cf. also Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=246:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 246, 12</bibl> Müll.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>dum-taxo; hence, lit., as far as it holds good, extends</etym>. <sense id="n14911.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To this extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as far as this matter is concerned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem jejunitatem et siccitatem ... dummodo sit polito ... in Attico genere ponit, hoc recte dumtaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos animo dumtaxat vigemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sint ista pulchriora dumtaxat adspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 90" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:17:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 17, § 1</bibl>: dumtaxat de peculio, <hi rend="ital">as far as relates to the</hi> peculium, Edict. Praet. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:7:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 7, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14911.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, defining a limit, either as maximum or as minimum, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the proper measure</hi>, which may be <hi rend="ital">not more</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">not less.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14911.2" n="A" level="2"> (<hi rend="ital">Not more</hi>, i. e.) <hi rend="ital">Only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merely</hi> = tantummodo. </sense><sense id="n14911.3" n="1" level="3"> Esp. in specifying numbers and amounts: MITTANTVR MVLIERES LIBERAE DVMTAXAT QVINQVE, Edict. Praet. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:4:1:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 4, 1, § 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: secum duxerit dum taxat homines IIL. (= duodequinquaginta), Lex. Acil. Repet. 32; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 49</bibl> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 198</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut consules potestatem haberent tempore dumtaxat annuam, genere ipso ac jure regiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; in tmesis: eum quis volet magistratus multare, dum minore parti familiae taxat, liceto, Lex Silia A. U. C. 510, Huschke, Jurisp. Antejust. p. 10.—</sense><sense id="n14911.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., in other restrictive applications: <cit><quote lang="la">dumtaxat, ut hoc promittere possis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 378</bibl></cit>: peditatu dumtaxat procul ad speciem utitur, equites in aciem mittit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41, 2</bibl>: Cato enim dumtaxat de magnitudine animi, etc., <hi rend="ital">simply</hi>, Cic. Par. ad prooem. 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 44, 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 42</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:42" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:36 al" default="NO">9, 36 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14911.5" n="3" level="3"> So, non dumtaxat = non modo: <cit><quote lang="la">non rebus dumtaxat, sed etiam moribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:12:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 12, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eos dumtaxat, sed omnes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:235" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 235</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dumtaxat animum vobis fidelem praestitit, sed omnibus interfuit bellis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14911.6" n="B" level="2"> (<hi rend="ital">Not less</hi>, i. e.) <hi rend="ital">At least</hi> = saltem. </sense><sense id="n14911.7" n="1" level="3"> Like A. 1., esp. in numerical specifications: obsonari dumtaxat ad minam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 91</bibl>: cum in testamento scriptum esset, <pb n="619" /> <cb n="DUOD" /> ut heres in funere aut in monumento DVMTAXAT AVREOS CENTVM consumeret, non licet minus consumere, si amplius vellet, licet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:202" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim Arpinum irem, ni te in Formiano commodissime exspectari viderem, dumtaxat ad prid. Non. Mai.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">IBI EPVLENTVR DVMTAXAT IN V. ID. IVL.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 707</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14911.8" n="2" level="3"> In gen., in other restrictive applications: <cit><quote lang="la">valde me Athenae delectarunt: urbs dumtaxat et urbis ornamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:53 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 53 al.</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:2" default="NO">2, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantum virtutes cujusque digne prosecutus, sed vitia quoque et delicta, dumtaxat modica, perpessus,</quote> <trans><tr>at least</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14911.9" n="3" level="3"> In a very few passages dumtaxat approaches so nearly in meaning to dummodo that it may be rendered by a conjunction in Eng., <hi rend="ital">provided that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, cum luxuriose viverent, non reprehenderentur eo nomine dumtaxat cetera caverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl> supra; v. Hand, Turs. II. pp. 330-339.</sense></entryFree>
dumus: <entryFree id="n14912" type="main" key="du_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūmus</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dusmus</orth>, v. dumosus), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dusmus for densimus, from densus</etym>, <sense id="n14912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thorn-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bramble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 315</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">338</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 526</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
duntaxat: <entryFree id="n14913" type="main" key="duntaxat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">duntaxat</orth>, v. dumtaxat.</entryFree>
duo: <entryFree id="n14914" type="main" key="du^o^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ</orth>, <itype>ae, ŏ</itype> (<sense id="n14914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. masc.</hi> duo as freq. as duos; cf. ambo. Passages with duo, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 101</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:1:9" default="NO">3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14</bibl>; 2, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 9</bibl>; id. Tull. § 19 Beier <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11</bibl>, A, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 69, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 285</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 15 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> duūm, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 102</bibl> P.; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 17, 18, § 63</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> dua, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and connected with pondo, also duapondo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 45" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 15</bibl>.—The metre dŭō occurs only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 19, 13</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi> [Sanscr. dva; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">du/o, du/w</foreign>; Goth. tvai; Germ. zwei; Engl. two; cf.: bis (for dvis), dubius, duplex, etc.]. </sense><sense id="n14914.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi ambo et servus et hera frustra sunt duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues duo maxumi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo talenta argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14914.2" n="II" level="1"> = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi( du/o</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito edicunt duo consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo sapientia praestantes, pater et socer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocuit sua culpa duobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos inter duos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui duo populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duodecajugum: <entryFree id="n14915" type="main" key="du^o^de^ca^ju^gum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdĕcăjŭgum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hybr., <foreign lang="greek">duo/deka</foreign> + jugum</etym>, <sense id="n14915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a team of twelve animals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 4.</sense></entryFree>
duodecas: <entryFree id="n14916" type="greek" key="du^o_de^cas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭōdĕcas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">duwdeka/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number twelve</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duodecennis: <entryFree id="n14917" type="main" key="du^o^de^cennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdĕcennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duodecim-annus</etym>, <sense id="n14917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twelve years old</hi>, Sulpic. Sever. Dial. 1, 10; 3, 2.</sense></entryFree>
duodecennium: <entryFree id="n14918" type="main" key="du^o^de^cenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdĕcennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>duodecennis</etym>, <sense id="n14918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of twelve years</hi>, Cod. Th. 2, 27, 1, § 6.</sense></entryFree>
duodecies: <entryFree id="n14919" type="main" key="du^o^de^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdĕcĭes</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭens</orth>, quadrisyl., Auct. Carm. de Phoenice, 28), <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>duodecim</etym>, <sense id="n14919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twelve times</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duodecim: <entryFree id="n14920" type="main" key="du^o^de^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdĕcim</orth>, <sense id="n14920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi> [duo-decem], <hi rend="ital">twelve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5, 2</bibl> et saep.—So, duodecim (and more freq. XII.) Tabulae, <hi rend="ital">the laws of the Twelve Tables</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 22</bibl> Müll. et saep.; called also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecim (or XII.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23</bibl></cit> (repeatedly); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16 al.</bibl> (v. Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. pp. 253-265).</sense></entryFree>
duodecimus: <entryFree id="n14921" type="main" key="du^o^de^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ord. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the twelfth</hi> (a common word in Caes.): <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 1</bibl>; 7, 62, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 34, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdĕcĭmo</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the twelfth time</hi>: consul, Capitol. Anton. Pius, 1, § 8.</sense></entryFree>
duodecimvir: <entryFree id="n14922" type="gloss" key="du^o^de^cimvir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdĕcim-vir</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the twelve</hi> commissioners, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3969</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duodenarius: <entryFree id="n14923" type="hapax" key="du^o^de_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duodeni</etym>, <sense id="n14923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing twelve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 34</bibl></cit> Müll. <cb n="DUOV" /></sense></entryFree>
duodeni: <entryFree id="n14924" type="main" key="du^o^de_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n14924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distr. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twelve each; twelve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores habent deni duodenique inter se communes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodena describit in singulos homines jugera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa duplex duodenūm pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 232</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 618</bibl></cit>: nec inveniuntur qui velint debere rei publicae, praesertim duodenis assibus, <hi rend="ital">at twelve per cent.</hi>, Plin. et Traj. Epist. 54, 1.</sense></entryFree>
duodennium: <entryFree id="n14925" type="main" key="du^o^dennium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏdennium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n14925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space of twelve years</hi>, Mythogr. Vat. 3, p. 163 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> (al. duodecennium).</sense></entryFree>
duodenonaginta: <entryFree id="n14926" type="main" key="du^o^de_no_na_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-nōnāginta</orth> (written LXXXVIII.), <sense id="n14926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eighty-eight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duodeoctoginta: <entryFree id="n14927" type="main" key="du^o^de_octo_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-octōginta</orth>, <sense id="n14927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seventy-eight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duodequadrageni: <entryFree id="n14928" type="main" key="du^o^de_qua_^dra_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-quā^drāgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n14928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distr. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirty-eight each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; and 36, 15, 24, § 114.</sense></entryFree>

duodequadraginta: <entryFree id="n14930" type="main" key="du^o^de_qua_^dra_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-quā^drāginta</orth>, <sense id="n14930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirty-eight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

duodesexaginta: <entryFree id="n14935" type="main" key="du^o^de_sexa_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-sexāginta</orth>, <sense id="n14935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiftyeight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 9, 9, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duodetricesimus: <entryFree id="n14936" type="main" key="du^o^de_tri_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-trīcēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ordin. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the twenty - eighth</hi>: dies, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

duodetriginta: <entryFree id="n14938" type="main" key="du^o^de_tri_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-trīginta</orth>, <sense id="n14938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twentyeight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
duodeviceni: <entryFree id="n14939" type="main" key="du^o^de_vi_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-vīcēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n14939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distr. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eighteen each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">denarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duodevicesimus: <entryFree id="n14940" type="main" key="du^o^de_vi_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-vīcēsĭmus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">viges-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ordin. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eighteenth</hi>, Cato and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 100, 11 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, per tmesin: duo enim devicesima Olympiade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duodeviginti: <entryFree id="n14941" type="main" key="du^o^de_vi_ginti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-dē-vīginti</orth>, <sense id="n14941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eighteen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:74 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 74 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:71 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 71 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: annis mille centum et duobus de viginti fere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duoetvicesimani: <entryFree id="n14942" type="main" key="du^o^etvi_ce_si^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-et-vīcēsĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duoet-vicesimus</etym>, <sense id="n14942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the twenty-second legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duoetvicesimus: <entryFree id="n14943" type="main" key="du^o^etvi_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏ-et-vīcēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ordin. num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the twenty-second</hi>: anno, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 24</bibl>; 4, 37; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
duonus: <entryFree id="n14944" type="main" key="duonus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">duonus</orth>, v. bonus <sense id="n14944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duovir: <entryFree id="n14945" type="main" key="du^o^vir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏvir</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype>, and usu. <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭŏvĭri</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭri</orth>, <itype>Zumpt</itype>, Gram. § 124; Krebs, Antibarb. p. 391; in MSS. and Inscr. usu. II. vir, II. viri; <sense id="n14945.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">but, DVOVIRES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DVOVIRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3886</bibl></cit>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>du + vir</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman board</hi> or <hi rend="ital">court consisting of two persons.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14945.1" n="I" level="1"> Perduellionis, <hi rend="ital">an extraordinary criminal court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the duumviri</hi>, anciently selected by the kings or the people for each case as it arose; <cit><quote lang="la">so in the trial of Horatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of M. Manlius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of C. Rabirius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; v. Mommsen, Hist. 1, 204.—</sense><sense id="n14945.2" n="II" level="1"> Sacrorum, <hi rend="ital">the keepers of the Sibylline books</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 13, 6</bibl>; cf. Dion. Hal. 4, 62 (afterwards decemviri and quindecimviri were elected for this purpose; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>); v. Mommsen, Hist. 1, 240.—</sense><sense id="n14945.3" n="III" level="1"> Navales, <hi rend="ital">an extraordinary board created for the purpose of equipping fleets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 1, 2 sq.</bibl>; v. Mommsen, Hist. 1, 531; 4, 136. —</sense><sense id="n14945.4" n="IV" level="1"> Ad aedem faciendam (dedicandam, locandam), <hi rend="ital">the</hi> duumviri <hi rend="ital">for building</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dedicating a temple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 28, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 33, 8</bibl>.—In the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">duumvir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 41, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 34, 5</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n14945.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The highest board</hi> <cb n="DUPL" /> <hi rend="ital">of magistrates in the</hi> municipia and colonies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2540</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVINQVENNALES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3882 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">IVRI DICVNDO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3805 sq.</bibl></cit>—In the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">DVOVIR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3813 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4982</bibl>; also <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3886</bibl> (Momms. 1956).—</sense><sense id="n14945.6" n="VI" level="1"> VIIS EXTRA URBEM PURGANDIS, <hi rend="ital">officers who had the charge of the streets of the suburbs of Rome</hi>, Tab. Heracl. 1, 50 ed. Göttling.</sense></entryFree>
duplaris: <entryFree id="n14946" type="main" key="du^pla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭplāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duplus</etym>, <sense id="n14946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing double</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>one who receives double pay as a reward</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also in the form DUPLARIUS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2003</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3476 al.</bibl>, v. duplicarius.</sense></entryFree>
duplarius: <entryFree id="n14947" type="gloss" key="du_^pla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plārĭus</orth>, v. praeced.</entryFree>
duplatio: <entryFree id="n14948" type="main" key="du_^pla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>duplo</etym>, <sense id="n14948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doubling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duplex: <entryFree id="n14949" type="main" key="du_^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> commonly duplici; <sense id="n14949.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">duplice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duo-plico</etym>, <hi rend="ital">twofold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14949.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et duplices hominum facies et corpora bina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 452</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aër (with geminus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus (with duae viae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (opp. simplex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus (opp. par and sesquiplex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:193" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 193</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">duplici de semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem locum duplici altissimo muro munierant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa duodenūm pedum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 36</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 63, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <trans><tr>consisting of two leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum,</quote> <trans><tr>consisting of two boards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 83, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 67, 3 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex fit bonitas, simul accessit celeritas,</quote> <trans><tr>who gives promptly gives twice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:141" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 141</bibl></cit> (Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n14949.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14949.3" n="1" level="3"> Of things made double by being divided into two, <hi rend="ital">cloven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bipartite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne duplices habeatis linguas, ne ego bilingues vos necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 10, 6</bibl> (1, 38, p. 265 Bip; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, p. 281</bibl> Bip.): <cit><quote lang="la">folia palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14949.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diplou=s</foreign>, of things in pairs, for ambo or uterque, <hi rend="ital">both</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 327</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14949.5" n="3" level="3"> Opp. to single, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diplou=s</foreign> and our double, for <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:20" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pannus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 22 (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum fenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>). —</sense><sense id="n14949.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> in post-Aug. prose, for alterum tantum, <hi rend="ital">twice as much as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex quam ceteris pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n14949.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14949.8" n="1" level="3"> Of words, <hi rend="ital">of a double sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba dubia et quasi duplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14949.9" n="2" level="3"> In poets, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diplou=s</foreign>, of character, qs. <hi rend="ital">double-tongued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double-faced</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amathusia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^-plĭcĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">doubly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on two accounts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 510</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res conscriptae,</quote> <trans><tr>ambiguously</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 23, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duplicarius: <entryFree id="n14950" type="main" key="du_^pli^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duplex</etym>, <sense id="n14950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier who receives double pay as a reward</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 90</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3533</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4994</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37</bibl>; and 24, 47); <cit><quote lang="la">also written DUPLICIARIUS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3534</bibl></cit>; see also duplaris.</sense></entryFree>
duplicatio: <entryFree id="n14951" type="main" key="du_^pli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>duplico</etym>, <sense id="n14951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doubling</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">radiorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reflection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 19, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14951.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n14951.2" n="(a)" level="5"> As arithm. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a doubling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multiplication by two</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 750</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14951.3" n="(b)" level="5"> As jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the answering of one objection by another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning an objection upon an adversary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:127" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> 4, 127</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14951.4" n="(g)" level="5"> As rhet. fig., = <foreign lang="greek">a)nadi/plwsis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the repetition</hi> of a word in beginning a clause, Ruf. Schem. Lex. § 8.</sense></entryFree>
duplicato: <entryFree id="n14952" type="main" key="du_^pli^ca_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭcāto</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twice as much</hi>, v. duplico <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duplicator: <entryFree id="n14953" type="main" key="du_^pli^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duplico</etym>, <sense id="n14953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doubler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnifier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dupliciarius: <entryFree id="n14954" type="gloss" key="dupli^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">duplĭcĭārĭus</orth>, v. duplicarius.</entryFree>
duplicitas: <entryFree id="n14955" type="main" key="du_^pli^ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>duplex</etym>, <sense id="n14955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being double</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubleness</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aurium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. Dei 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>. <pb n="620" /> <cb n="DURA" /></sense></entryFree>
dupliciter: <entryFree id="n14956" type="main" key="du_^pli^ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on two accounts</hi>, v. duplex <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duplico: <entryFree id="n14957" type="main" key="du_^pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (u long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 67</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>duplex</etym>, <sense id="n14957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to double</hi> (class.) </sense><sense id="n14957.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:78" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium legionibus in perpetuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to repeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit> (with iterare); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 6, 20 sq.</bibl>; also, <hi rend="ital">to form a bipartite word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compound</hi> (e. g. androgynus): <cit><quote lang="la">faciliore ad duplicanda verba Graeco sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14957.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14957.3" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to duplex, I. B. 3.), <hi rend="ital">to double</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobilitas duplicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplicato ejus diei itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 92, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sol crescentes decedens duplicat umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 550</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplicata nimbo flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in dies magis magisque haec nascens de me duplicetur opinio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: curam, Sall. Or. Cottae, p. 245 ed. Gerl.; cf. sollicitudines, Lucei. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>: bellum, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 2, 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14957.4" n="B" level="2"> In poets and in post-Aug. prose meton. (effectu pro causa), <hi rend="ital">to double up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi> a person or thing: nos duplicat timos, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 487</bibl> (Trag. v. 45 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">duplicato poplite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 927</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 645</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 859</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14957.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To double by dividing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to split in two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭcāto</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">twice as much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">degredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duplio: <entryFree id="n14958" type="main" key="du_^pli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duplus</etym>, <sense id="n14958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the double</hi> of any thing (very rare), XII. Tab. ap. Fest. S. V. VINDICIAE, p. 376, 30 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 12</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66, 13</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n14958.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the double of the perfect number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">six</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">twelve</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">diplasi/wn</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duplo: <entryFree id="n14959" type="main" key="du_^plo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to double</hi> (only in jurid. Lat., for the class. duplico), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 38:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> ib. 38, 10, 3</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">duplabis</hi> duplicabis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14960" type="main" key="du_^plo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubly</hi>, v. duplus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duplus: <entryFree id="n14961" type="main" key="du_^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duplex</etym>, <sense id="n14961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">double</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twice as large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twice as much.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14961.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dupla et tripla intervalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: scrobes, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 751</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donativum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14961.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14961.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the double</hi> of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">a terra ad lunam centum viginti sex milia stadiorum esse, ab ea usque ad solem duplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 21, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 56</bibl>: furem dupli condemnari, feneratorem quadrupli, Cato R. R. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decrevit, ut, si judicatum negaret, in duplum iret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:20 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 20 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplo major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14961.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^pla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pecunia), <hi rend="ital">a double price</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:31:section=20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 31, § 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 2, 6</bibl> tit.: de evictionibus et duplae stipulatione.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^plo</orth>, <hi rend="ital">doubly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twofold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dupondiarius: <entryFree id="n14962" type="main" key="du_^pondi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^pondĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dupondius</etym>, <sense id="n14962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing two</hi> asses. </sense><sense id="n14962.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">orbiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭpondĭ-ārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. nummus), <hi rend="ital">a two-as piece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14962.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like diobolaris, <hi rend="ital">worth two coppers</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 74, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dupondius: <entryFree id="n14963" type="main" key="du_^pondi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dū^pondĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭpondĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:49:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 49, § 81</bibl>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭpon-dĭum</orth>, Gromat. Vet. p. 28, 14; p. 167, 11), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>duo-pondus</etym>, <sense id="n14963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sum of two</hi> asses. </sense><sense id="n14963.1" n="I" level="1"> As a coin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=169" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:section=81" default="NO">9, § 81</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14963.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14963.3" n="II" level="1"> As a measure, <hi rend="ital">two feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:2" default="NO">3, 15, 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
durabilis: <entryFree id="n14964" type="main" key="du_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duro</etym>, <sense id="n14964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durable</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): quod caret alterna requie durabile non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:1" default="NO">12, 55, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durabilior materies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 314, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cb n="DURI" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a lasting manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
durabilitas: <entryFree id="n14965" type="main" key="du_ra_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>durabilis</etym>, <sense id="n14965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lastingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durability</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">frumentorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 36, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duracinus: <entryFree id="n14966" type="main" key="du_ra^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrăcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>durus-acinus</etym>, orig. of the grape, <sense id="n14966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hard-berried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi> (only fit for eating): <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 14</bibl>; Suct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:76" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 22</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">persica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 12, 11, § 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duramen: <entryFree id="n14967" type="main" key="du_ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>duro</etym>, <sense id="n14967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>, concr. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 530</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a hardened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ligneous vinebranch</hi>, see the foll., I.</sense></entryFree>
duramentum: <entryFree id="n14968" type="main" key="du_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hardening</hi> in concreto. </sense><sense id="n14968.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hardened</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ligneous vine-branch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 12, 1</bibl>.—Called also duramen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14968.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a means of hardening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanae imbecillitatis efficacissimum duramentum est necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14968.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi> (with robur), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duranius: <entryFree id="n14969" type="main" key="Du^ra^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŭrănĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Gallia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Dordogne</hi>, Auson. Idyll. 9, 464; Sidon. Carm. 22, 103.</sense></entryFree>
durateus: <entryFree id="n14970" type="greek" key="du_ra^te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrătĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">donra/teos</foreign>, <sense id="n14970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wooden</hi>, only of the Trojan horse: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 477</bibl></cit> (the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppos donra/teos</foreign>, Od. 8, 493; 512); cf. durius.</sense></entryFree>
durator: <entryFree id="n14971" type="hapax" key="du_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duro</etym>, <sense id="n14971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who hardens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hardener</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 33" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duratrix: <entryFree id="n14972" type="main" key="du_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n14972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi> [durator], <hi rend="ital">that renders durable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dure: <entryFree id="n14973" type="main" key="du_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūre</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hardly</hi>, v. durus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dureo: <entryFree id="n14974" type="gloss" key="du_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>durus</etym>, <sense id="n14974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be hard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 1, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 800</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
duresco: <entryFree id="n14975" type="main" key="du_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūresco</orth>, <itype>rui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14975.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: durescit humor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl>; so in the <hi rend="ital">praes.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:417" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraque duruerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:831" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 831</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durescente materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14975.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: in alicujus lectione, qs. <hi rend="ital">to become ossified</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:16" default="NO">10, 5, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dureta: <entryFree id="n14976" type="foreign" key="dure_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">durēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a Span. word</etym>, <sense id="n14976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooden bathing-tub</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
duricordia: <entryFree id="n14977" type="main" key="du_ri^cordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭcordĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>durus-cor</etym>, <sense id="n14977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hardheartedness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duricorius: <entryFree id="n14978" type="hapax" key="du_ri^co^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭcŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>durus-corium</etym>, <sense id="n14978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hard-skinned</hi>: ficus, Cloatius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duris: <entryFree id="n14979" type="main" key="Duris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Duris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 30 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
duritas: <entryFree id="n14980" type="hapax" key="du_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>durus</etym>, <sense id="n14980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis (with severitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
duriter: <entryFree id="n14981" type="main" key="du_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hardly</hi>, etc., v. durus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duritia: <entryFree id="n14982" type="main" key="du_ri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (also rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭtĭes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 6 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n14982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: duritiem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4</bibl>. 268; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 401</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 751</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 85</bibl> Jahn. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.; abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>durus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">hardness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14982.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14982.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 269</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 401</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and 4, 751: ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamantina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis coacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 64 sq.</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14982.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">induration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:250 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 250 al.</bibl></cit>—In the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:82 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 40, § 82 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:212" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 15, 60, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 22, § 55</bibl>; 28, 17, 70, § 234 al.—</sense><sense id="n14982.4" n="2" level="3"> Of wine, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh flavor</hi>, opp. suavitas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 74</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14982.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14982.6" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to durus, II. A.) <hi rend="ital">A severe mode of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerity</hi>: in parsimonia atque in duritia atque industria omnem adolescentiam meam abstinui, agro colendo, etc., Cato ap. Fest. S. V. REPASTINARI, p. 281, 23 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 56</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
