G. 6, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 23, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:6 al" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 6 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transf.: qui patientiam et duritiam in Socratico sermone maxime adamārat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14982.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Absence of feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensibility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam animi duritiam, sicut corporis, quod cum uritur non sentit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:36:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 36, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritiā ferrum ut superes adamantaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 137</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in eccl. Lat. freq. cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 19, 8</bibl></cit>; and duritia <cb n="DURO" /> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 9, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14982.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to durus, II.) <hi rend="ital">Harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strictness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>: tua duritia antiqua, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12, 20</bibl> (4, 11, 20 M.).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritiae mihi non agerere reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oris, qui depudere didicerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14982.9" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to durus, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritia lenitasve multarum (legum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli militiaeque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
durities: <entryFree id="n14983" type="main" key="du_ri^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭtĭes</orth>, v. duritia <sense id="n14983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
duritudo: <entryFree id="n14984" type="hapax" key="du_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>durus, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n14984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruelty</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 20</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 100, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
durius: <entryFree id="n14985" type="main" key="du_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dou/rios</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">dou/reios</foreign>, equus, <sense id="n14985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Trojan horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. 1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. 1</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 12</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duria nox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the night in which the Greeks descended from the interior of the horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:573" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 573</bibl></cit>; cf. durateus.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14986" type="main" key="Du^ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Laud. Ser. Reg. 72</bibl>), <sense id="n14986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the principal rivers of Spain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Douro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 112 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:234 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 234 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
duriusculus: <entryFree id="n14987" type="main" key="du_ri^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [durus, II. A.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages).—Of expression: Catullus, Plin. H. N. praef. § 2; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
duro: <entryFree id="n14988" type="main" key="du_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>durus</etym>, <sense id="n14988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n14988.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14988.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nobis durata ac spissa videntur, Haec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 444</bibl></cit>; so in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria (with condurare ferrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:970" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 970</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementa calce (opp. interlita luto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova in aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua salibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>strongly saturated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, v. durus, I.: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulas (mularum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum ictibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 43, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttas in grana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam fumo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dry</tr>, <tr>preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 72</bibl></cit>.—In medic. lang.: corpus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make costive</hi>, opp. mollire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In fullers' lang., <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiffen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">full</hi> cloth: <hi rend="ital">Art.</hi> Non queo durare. <hi rend="ital">Par.</hi> Si non didicisti fulloniam, non mirandumst, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 57</bibl> (with a punning reference to the meaning II. A. 2.).— </sense><sense id="n14988.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum durare solum et discludere Nerea ponto Coeperit, i. q. durescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vino minime durante, uva maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14988.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14988.5" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to durus, II. A. 2.). </sense><sense id="n14988.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden with use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">labor</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to make hardy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">callous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inure</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opere in duro membra manusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1359</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">membra animumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros ad vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 257</bibl></cit>: hoc se labore durant homines adolescentes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum crebris expeditionibus, patientiaque periculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 15 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab duratis usu armorum pulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29</bibl></cit>; so in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">durati bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia durantur,</quote> <trans><tr>grow inveterate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14988.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (so most freq.), <hi rend="ital">to be hardened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inured to troubles</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be patient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere; to endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durare nequeo in aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 604</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 82 al.</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">durate et vosmet rebus servate secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 207</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 27 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo durare, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durare nequeo quin intro eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14988.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">patior quemvis durare laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quascumque vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:153" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 153</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of inanimate subjects: sine funibus Vix durare carinae Possunt imperiosius Aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitis genus) quod siccitatem durat et ventos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14988.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quis parumper durare opperier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14988.10" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to continue in existence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi> (very freq.): <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Ubi illaec (talenta) quae dedi ante? <hi rend="ital">Cl.</hi> Abusa. Num si ea durarent mihi, <pb n="621" /> <cb n="DURU" /> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti quam diutissime durent oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:58" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem durare per aevom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 605</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 812</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque post mortem durare videtur (corpus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 339</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 561</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad posteros virtus durabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:9" default="NO">3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:41" default="NO">5, 11, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maneat quaeso duretque gentibus, si non amor nostri, at certe odium sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durante originis vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 96, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">durante bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 39</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">adhuc</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munera, quibus donatus est, durant, ostendunturque adhuc Bais,</quote> <trans><tr>are still in existence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vivere durent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 519</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:653" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 653</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:75" default="NO">11, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 2</bibl>.—In Tacitus sometimes of persons, for vivere, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratum ab iis, qui nostram ad juventam duraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 44</bibl>. And once in the same author (acc. to the better reading) of extension in space: durant colles (= continuantur, ultra porriguntur; French, <hi rend="ital">s'y prolongent</hi>), <hi rend="ital">extend continuously to the frontier</hi>, Germ. 30.—</sense><sense id="n14988.11" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to durus, II. B.) </sense><sense id="n14988.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">callous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible; to dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blunt</hi> (rare and perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aerea dehinc ferro (Juppiter) duravit saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad plagas durari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. § <cit><quote lang="la">12: quae in pravam induruerunt): ad omne facinus durato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl></cit>.—Of the affections, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 39, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae vitia, inemendabili in posterum pravitate durantur,</quote> <trans><tr>to become confirmed</tr>, <tr>incurable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14988.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">callous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut non durat (pater) ultra poenam abdicationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nullius umquam suorum necem duravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad caedem ejus duratura filii odia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
durocortorum: <entryFree id="n14989" type="main" key="Du_ro^corto^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūrŏcortŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*douriko/rtora</foreign>, <sense id="n14989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of the</hi> Remi <hi rend="ital">in Gallia Belgica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rheims</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 44, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duronius: <entryFree id="n14990" type="main" key="Duronius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Duronius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:274 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 274 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
durus: <entryFree id="n14991" type="main" key="du_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. root dhar, to fix, confirm</etym>, <sense id="n14991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hard.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14991.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14991.2" n="A" level="2"> Orig. as affecting the sense of feeling: <cit><quote lang="la">et validi silices ac duri robora ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 449</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 366</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 672</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipennes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 502</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 341</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 805</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 27</bibl>: aqua, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">containing much earthy matter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">muria,</quote> <trans><tr>saturated with salt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:6:1" default="NO">12, 6, 1</bibl> et saep., v. muria: <cit><quote lang="la">dumeta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 105</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">gallina,</quote> <trans><tr>tough</tr>, <tr>not yet boiled tender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi, qui in coquendo duriores fient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ladanum durissimum tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 30, § 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">durissimus tophus vel carbunculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n14991.3" n="(a)" level="5"> E duro (sc. ligno), <hi rend="ital">of the hardened wood of the vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:15" default="NO">3, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:21" default="NO">21</bibl> et saep.; cf. duramentum.— </sense><sense id="n14991.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Durum cacare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:89:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 89, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14991.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14991.6" n="1" level="3"> As affecting the sense of taste: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum, opp. suavis,</quote> <trans><tr>hard</tr>, <tr>harsh</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 40</bibl></cit> and 351.— </sense><sense id="n14991.7" n="2" level="3"> As affecting the ear: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis genera permulta: ... grave acutum, flexibile durum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl> and 32.—Hence, in rhet., <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> (cf. asper, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">aspera et dura et dissoluta et hians oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 32 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 142</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14991.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14991.9" n="A" level="2"> Opp. to cultivated, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rulde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Aelius Tubero ut vita sic oratione durus, incultus, horridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Stoici) horridiores evadunt, asperiores, duriores, et oratione et moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attilius poëta durissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marius, qui durior ad haec studia videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> prooem. § 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictor durus in coloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl>: Fauni, gens duro robore <cb n="DURU" /> nata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 315</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrea progenies duris caput extulit arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 341</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:276 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 276 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14991.10" n="2" level="3"> But sometimes as a praiseworthy quality, opp. to soft, weakly, <hi rend="ital">hardy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi> (esp. freq. in poets): <cit><quote lang="la">fortes et duri Spartiatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligures, durum in armis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durum genus experiensque laborum,</quote> <trans><tr>hardy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde homines nati, durum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 63</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">la=as</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">lao/s</foreign>, Pind. Ol. 9, 71): <cit><quote lang="la">gens dura atque aspera cultu,</quote> <trans><tr>a hardy race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus humanum durius, tellus quod dura creāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:926" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 926</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dardanidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iberia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia messorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 584</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n14991.11" n="B" level="2"> Opp. to morally mild, gentle, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfeeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis se tam durum agrestemque praeberet, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 148</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis nostrum animo tam agresti et duro fuit, ut? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sunt audiendi, qui virtutem duram et quasi ferream esse quandam volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio esse duro atque inexorabili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis pater durus fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varius qui est habitus judex durior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala vel duri lacrimas motura Catonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 50</bibl></cit>: duriorem se praebere alicujus miserae et afflictae fortunae, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl> A (cf. opp. at the end of the letter: se <hi rend="ital">placabiliorem</hi> praebere): <cit><quote lang="la">duri hominis vel potius vix hominis videtur, periculum capitis inferre multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nos dura refugimus aetas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ōs durum,</quote> <trans><tr>shameless</tr>, <tr>impudent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 36</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 451</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 3, 27</bibl></cit> et saep. Of the austerity of the Stoic mode of living, v. above, A.—</sense><sense id="n14991.12" n="C" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toilsome; troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdensome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable; adverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulento homini hoc servitus dura est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl> A: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura cultu et aspera plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durissimo tempore anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum acrem ac durum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 485</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen (opp. molle),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Etiamne id lex coëgit? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Illud durum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; so in the <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:36" default="NO">12, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 42</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ellipt.: non vanae redeat sanguis imagini ... Durum: sed levius fit patientia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 19</bibl></cit>. In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dura</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">hardships</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficulties</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccis omnia dura deus proposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 208" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 522</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego dura tuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:544 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 544 al.</bibl></cit> (In <hi rend="ital">fem. plur.</hi> ellipt., sc. partes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 22</bibl> very dub.).— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi, si quid erat durius, concurrebant,</quote> <trans><tr>if any unusual difficulty occurred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 94, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv. posit.</hi> in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dūrĭter</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dūre</orth>. </sense><sense id="n14991.13" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to 1. A.) <hi rend="ital">Hardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga premunt duriter colla (boum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14991.14" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A.-C.) </sense><sense id="n14991.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiffly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra moventes Duriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duriter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:19" default="NO">10, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:15" default="NO">9, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:117" default="NO">117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14991.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Hardily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam parce ac duriter agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 20</bibl>; Novius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 512</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14991.17" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tibi ex ore orationem duriter dictis dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 348" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 348</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">duriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:Com. v. 251" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> Com. v. 251</bibl></cit> Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 28</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 42</bibl>, <cb n="DYOD" /> 7.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Hadrian. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:14:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14991.18" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfavorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durius cadentibus rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dusaritis: <entryFree id="n14992" type="main" key="Du_saritis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūsaritis</orth> <itype>myrrha</itype>, <sense id="n14992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of myrrh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 16, 35, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dusmosus: <entryFree id="n14993" type="main" key="dusmo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dusmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. dumosus.</entryFree>

duumvira: <entryFree id="n14995" type="main" key="du^umvi^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>duumvir</etym>, <sense id="n14995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of a duumvir</hi>, Renier, Inscr. Afr. 3914.</sense></entryFree>
duumviralicius: <entryFree id="n14996" type="gloss" key="du^umvi^ra_licius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭrālicius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duumviralis</etym>, <sense id="n14996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has been a duumvir</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3721</bibl> (Momms. 635; 189).</sense></entryFree>
duumviralis: <entryFree id="n14997" type="main" key="du^umvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duumviri</etym>, <sense id="n14997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a duumvir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duumviral.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14997.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">POTESTATE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 29, 129</bibl></cit>.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n14997.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">duumviralis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has been a auumvir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3727</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3816</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duumviralitas: <entryFree id="n14998" type="main" key="du^umvi^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>duumviralis</etym>, <sense id="n14998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office and dignity of a duumvir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duumvirate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
duumviratus: <entryFree id="n14999" type="main" key="du^umvi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭrātus</orth> (also DVOMVIR., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Momms.</author> 2378</bibl>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>duumviri</etym>, <sense id="n14999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a duumvir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duumvirate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3817</bibl> (Momms. 2096; 4059).</sense></entryFree>
duumviri: <entryFree id="n15000" type="main" key="du^umvi^ri1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭri</orth>, v. duovir.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n15001" type="main" key="du^umvi^ri2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭumvĭri</orth>, v. duumvir.</entryFree>
dux: <entryFree id="n15002" type="main" key="dux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dux</orth>, <itype>dŭcis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> <etym>duco</etym>, <sense id="n15002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conductor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi> (for syn. cf.: imperator, ductor, tyrannus, rex, princeps, praetor, auctor). </sense><sense id="n15002.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">illis non ducem locorum, non exploratorem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regendae civitatis (with auctor publici consilii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux isti quondam et magister ad despoliandum Dianae templum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil desperandum Teucro duce et auspice Teucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu dux et comes es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:119" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 12, 23</bibl> et saep. —In the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 364</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 121</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15002.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general-in-chief.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15002.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 4</bibl> (with qui summam <hi rend="ital">imperii</hi> tenebat); 3, 18, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 23, 3 et saep.—Prov.: ducis in consilio posita est virtus militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:136" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 136</bibl></cit> (Rib.). Also <hi rend="ital">a lieutenant-general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general of division</hi> (cf. duco, I. B. 5. b., and imperator), as opp. to the imperator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 37 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15002.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux regit examen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gregis, i. e. aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 327</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 311</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:58" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but dux gregis = pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenti, i. e. taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:884" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 884</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the head of a sect of philosophers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 638</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dyas: <entryFree id="n15003" type="greek" key="dy^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dyas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dua/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number two</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dymas: <entryFree id="n15004" type="main" key="Dy^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dymas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*du/mas</foreign>, <sense id="n15004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Hecuba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 761</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 320</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 91" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:111" default="NO">111</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dy-mantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Dymas</hi>: proles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hecuba;</hi> and, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dyman-tis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Dymas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hecuba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 620</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dyme: <entryFree id="n15005" type="main" key="Dy_me"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dȳme</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*du/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n15005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old sea-coast town in Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">west of Olenos</hi>, now perhaps <hi rend="ital">Kaminitza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 13</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dȳmae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 29</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15005.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dȳmaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Dymae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Dymaean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dȳmaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Dymaeans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dynamice: <entryFree id="n15006" type="greek" key="dy^na^mi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dynămĭcē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dunamikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n15006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the science of forces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dynamics</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3</bibl>. 10.</sense></entryFree>
dynamis: <entryFree id="n15007" type="greek" key="dy^na^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dynămis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">du/namis</foreign>. * <sense id="n15007.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A store</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plenty</hi> (cf. the Lat. vis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15007.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A square number</hi> (cf. potestas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 106</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dynastes: <entryFree id="n15008" type="greek" key="dy^nastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dynastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">duna/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n15008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prince</hi> (partic. of a small country), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15008.1" n="II" level="1"> Of the triumvirs at Rome: <cit><quote lang="la">si erit nebulo iste cum his dynastis in gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dyodecas: <entryFree id="n15009" type="greek" key="dy^o_de^cas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dyōdĕcas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">duwdeka/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tweive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dozen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 49</bibl>. <pb n="622" /> <cb n="E" /></sense></entryFree>
dyonymus: <entryFree id="n15010" type="greek" key="dy^o_ny^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dyōnymus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">duw/numos</foreign>, <sense id="n15010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two names</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 580</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dyraspes: <entryFree id="n15011" type="main" key="Dy^raspes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dyraspes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Scythia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 10, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dyrrachium: <entryFree id="n15012" type="main" key="Dyrra^chi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dyrrăchĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Dyrrh-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*durra/xion</foreign>, <sense id="n15012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous sea-coast town of Grecian Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the landing-place of those coming from Italy</hi>, formerly called Epidamnus, now <hi rend="ital">Durazzo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 12</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dyrră-chīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*durraxhnoi/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dyr-răchēni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dyscolus: <entryFree id="n15013" type="main" key="dysco^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dyscŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">du/skolos</foreign>, <sense id="n15013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a bad temper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peevish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 2, 18.</sense></entryFree>
dysenteria: <entryFree id="n15014" type="greek" key="dy^sente^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dysentĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dusenteri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dysentery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 28, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:128" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 33, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6:84 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 6, 84 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 28, 8</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
dysentericus: <entryFree id="n15015" type="greek" key="dy^sente^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dysentĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dusenteriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to dysentery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dysenteric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (= <foreign lang="greek">dusenterika\ pa/qh</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl>).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dysen-tericus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has the dysentery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 55, § 116</bibl> sqq.; 26, 8, 28, § 44 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 85" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 85</bibl>; Firm. Math. 8.</sense></entryFree>
dyseros: <entryFree id="n15016" type="greek" key="dy^se^ro_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dysĕrōs</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">du/serws</foreign>, <sense id="n15016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loving unfortunately</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 92, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dyspepsia: <entryFree id="n15017" type="greek" key="dyspepsi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dyspepsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">duspeyi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indigestion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dyspepsia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:127:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 127, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dysphoricus: <entryFree id="n15018" type="greek" key="dyspho^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dysphŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dusforiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 12.</sense></entryFree>
dyspnoea: <entryFree id="n15019" type="greek" key="dyspnoea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dyspnoea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">du/spnoia</foreign>, <sense id="n15019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a difficulty of breathing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 47, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 19, § 33</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl>, written as Greek). —Hence,</sense></entryFree>
dyspnoicus: <entryFree id="n15020" type="greek" key="dyspno^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dyspnŏĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">duspnoi+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who labors under difficulty of breathing.— Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 14, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:28:147" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 28, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dysprophoron: <entryFree id="n15021" type="main" key="dyspro^pho^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dysprŏphŏron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">duspro/foron</foreign>, <sense id="n15021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mispronunciation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 514</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dysuria: <entryFree id="n15022" type="greek" key="dy^su_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dysūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dusouri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">retention of urine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dysury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:64" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 64</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 10, 3</bibl>, written as Greek).— Hence,</sense></entryFree>
dysuriacus: <entryFree id="n15023" type="greek" key="dy^su_ri^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dysūrĭăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dusouriako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who suffers from suppression of urine</hi>, Firm, Math. 8. <cb n="E." /></sense></entryFree>
e: <entryFree id="n15024" type="main" key="E" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">E</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">e</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> or (sc. littera) <sense id="n15024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, a vowel corresponding to both the <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign> and the <foreign lang="greek">h</foreign> of the Greeks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2386" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2386</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. de Litter. Monos. 3</bibl> and 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 235</bibl>. Its sound varied; short <hi rend="ital">e</hi> being sounded sometimes like Engl. <hi rend="ital">e</hi> in <hi rend="ital">men</hi> (so in pater, inter, etc.), sometimes more nearly like short <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, as in Engl. pin (so in famelia, mereto, Menerva, etc.); whence, in the literary language, it passed, in a large class of words, into <hi rend="ital">ĭ</hi> (familia, merito, etc.), though retained in the popular speech, and oft. in inscriptions. Long <hi rend="ital">e</hi> also varied in sound, often resembling the diphthong <hi rend="ital">ae</hi>, with which it is constantly confounded in MSS. and inscrr. (cf. raeda and reda; saeculum and seculum; ceteri and caeteri, etc.), and often approaching the sound of ī (v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 324 sqq.). The short <hi rend="ital">e</hi> in Latin is the least emphatic of all the vowels; hence, it not only took the place of other vowels in changes of words where the sounds became weakened, and in the vulgar language where the vowel sounds were less sharply distinguished, but frequently took the place of a final syllable ending in a consonant, and was sometimes, especially at the end of words, rejected.</sense><sense id="n15024.1" n="b" level="4"> The transition of <hi rend="ital">ă</hi> into <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> (which took place especially before two consonants, whereas usually <hi rend="ital">ă</hi> passed into <hi rend="ital">ĭ</hi> in open syllables, v. art. A.) is seen in the compounds refello, commendo, ineptus, confercio, incestus, perpetior, etc. In some words the orthography is unsettled, as in the compounds of spargo, which are written<cb n="E" />  sometimes aspergo, conspergo, dispergo, etc., and sometimes aspargo, conspargo, dispargo, etc.; as along with dispando the vulgar form dispenno also occurs. So in all the verbal reduplications, as cĕcidi, cĕcini, pĕperi, pĕpigi, tĕtigi; pĕperci, fĕfelli; dĕdi and stĕti (from cado, cano, pario, pango, tango, parco, fallo, DA and STA), whereas the vowels <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, <hi rend="ital">o</hi>, <hi rend="ital">u</hi> remain unchanged in reduplication (bĭbi; mŏmordi; tŭtudi; for the anomalous forms in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9</bibl>, are certainly Graecized). As along with pĕpĭgi there also arose by syncope (in the Lat. lang. a predominating element in the formation of words) the perfect pēgi; so we may explain the perfect forms cēpi, fēci, jēci, frēgi, and ēgi, as syncopated from cĕcĭpi, fĕfĭci, jĕjĭci, frĕfĭgi, and ĕïgi (this last analogously with dēgo, from dēĭgo).</sense><sense id="n15024.2" n="c" level="4"> For <hi rend="ital">i</hi> stands <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> </sense><sense id="n15024.3" n="(a)" level="5"> in the neuter forms of the adjectives in <hi rend="ital">is</hi> (acre, agreste, facile, etc.).—</sense><sense id="n15024.4" n="(b)" level="5"> In the nominative forms: aedes, apes, canes, etc. (for aedis, apis, canis, etc. v. h. vv.).—</sense><sense id="n15024.5" n="(g)" level="5"> In the dative forms: morte, jure dicundo, Dijove, Victore, etc. (cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 192 sq.; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 17</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n15024.6" n="(d)" level="5"> In the nominatives in <hi rend="ital">es</hi>, whose genitive has ĭtis.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) In the nominatives from stems ending in <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, <hi rend="ital">b</hi>, <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, etc., as, pollex, caelebs, princeps, comes, flumen, from pollic-, caelib-, princip-, comit-, flumin-; and (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) In the old and partly vulgar manner of writing and pronouncing: CEPET, EXEMET, NAVEBOS (Colum. Rostr.), FVET, DEDET, TEMPESTATEBVS, TIBE (Epit. of the Scipios), COMPROMESISE (S. C. de Bacch.), MENERVA, MAGESTER, HERE, VEA, VELLA, etc. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl>, and 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 46</bibl>). In the earliest period (before Plautus) <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> was found in many words in which <hi rend="ital">ĭ</hi> afterwards took its place; as: semul, fuet, mereto, tempestatebus, etc.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) It is prob. too that the abl. <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> of the third declension proceeded from <hi rend="ital">ī</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">id</hi>); cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 239 sqq.; Corss. Ausspr. 2, 241 sq.</sense><sense id="n15024.7" n="d" level="4"> It less freq. happens that <hi rend="ital">o</hi> and <hi rend="ital">u</hi> pass over into <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi>, as vello, ocellus, verto, vertex, vester, compared with vulsi, oculus, vorto, vortex, voster: generis from genus, societas from socius, etc.; and even for long <hi rend="ital">u</hi> we have <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> in dejĕro and pejĕro, from jūro.</sense><sense id="n15024.8" n="e" level="4"> The stem vowel <hi rend="ital">o</hi> is weakened to <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> in the vocative of nouns in <hi rend="ital">us</hi> of the second declension; <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> also represents <hi rend="ital">o</hi> in the perf. and in pass. forms, such as scripsere, conabare, conabere, from scripserunt, conabaris, conaberis; in the future forms attinge, dice, facie, recipie, from attingam, dicam, faciam, recipiam (see under dico <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>); in the forms mage, pote, from magis, potis, etc.; it is inserted for euphony in the nom. of many nouns and adjj whose stems end in <hi rend="ital">r</hi> preceded by a mute, as ager, aper, liber, aeger, ruber, sacer, etc.</sense><sense id="n15024.9" n="f" level="4"> The vowel <hi rend="ital">e</hi> is suppressed in the imperatives dic, duc, fac, fer, in the anteclass infinitive biber (from bibere); in the vocative of the second declension of nouns in <hi rend="ital">ius</hi>, as Gai, geni, fili, canteri, columbari, mantuari, volturi, mi (cf. Freund in Jahn's Neue Jahrbüch, 1835, vol. 13, p. 148 sq.), in enclitic particles often, as: hic, haec, hoc, for hice, etc.; so, illaec, sic, nunc, nec, ac, etc.: viden, potin: quin, for quine, etc., and as an initial in the present forms of the verb esse (sum, sumus, sunt; sim, etc., for esum, esumus, esunt, esim, etc.). But the forms facul, simul, Bacchanal, etc., are not apocopated. Even a radical <hi rend="ital">ĕ</hi> sometimes drops out when a prefix or suffix is taken; so, gigno, for gigeno: malignus, for maligenus: gnatus, for genatus.</sense><sense id="n15024.10" n="g" level="4"> The long <hi rend="ital">e</hi> interchanges most freq. with the diphthongs <hi rend="ital">ae</hi> and <hi rend="ital">oe</hi> (q. v.); yet it sometimes also took the place of <hi rend="ital">ā</hi>, as in anhēlo, from hālo, and in the rustic bēlo, for bālo; and likewise of <hi rend="ital">ī</hi>, as LEBER, SPECA, AMECVS, for līber, spīca, amīcus (Quint. Inst. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 2</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15, 6</bibl> Müll.); and in words borrowed from the Greek, as chorēa, Darēus, along with Academīa, Alexandrīa; see the letter I.</sense><sense id="n15024.11" n="h" level="4"> As an abbreviation, E (mostly in connection with other abbreviations) signifies egregius, equus, eques, erexit, evocatus, etc.; e. g. E. M. V. = egregiae memoriae vir; E. Q. R. = eques Romanus; EE. QQ. RR. = equites Romani; E. P. = equo publico; <cb n="EBLA" /> E. M. D. S. P. E. = e monitu de sua pecunia erexit, etc.</sense><sense id="n15024.12" n="2. e." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">praep.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from</hi>, v. ex.</sense></entryFree>
ea: <entryFree id="n15025" type="main" key="ea_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eā</orth>, v. is.</entryFree>
