eadem: <entryFree id="n15026" type="main" key="ea_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eādem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">abl. f.</hi>, from idem, sc. viā, operā, or parte</etym>. <sense id="n15026.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">By the same way</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ventum est in trivium, eadem qua ceteri fugere noluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem revertens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem et Romanos sequentes impetus rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 33, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15026.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15026.2" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. operā, sometimes expressed, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 26</bibl>; prop., <hi rend="ital">by the same piece of work</hi>, i. e.) <hi rend="ital">At the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 180</bibl> (cf. Brix. ad loc.) eādem ego ex hoc quae volo exquaesivero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 43</bibl>. atque eādem mulieres apparebunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15026.3" n="B" level="2"> Repeated: eadem ... eadem, <hi rend="ital">now ... now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at one time ... at another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem biberis, eadem dedero tibi ubi biberis savium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit> (15).</sense></entryFree>
eale: <entryFree id="n15027" type="main" key="e^a^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large animal found in Ethiopia;</hi> acc. to Cuvier, <hi rend="ital">the two-horned rhinoceros</hi>, Plin 8, 21, 30, § 73.</sense></entryFree>
eapropter: <entryFree id="n15028" type="main" key="e^a_propter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕā-propter</orth> (= propter ea), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on that account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 3</bibl> Fleck. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Bon. Com. p. 238" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Bon. Com. p. 238</bibl> Rib.</sense></entryFree>
eapse: <entryFree id="n15029" type="main" key="e^apse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕapse</orth>, v. ipse <sense id="n15029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense><sense id="n15029.1" n="1" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕărĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)arino/s</foreign>, of the color of spring, i. e. <hi rend="ital">green</hi>: oves purpureas et earinas, Tert. Hab. mul. 8.</sense></entryFree>
earinus: <entryFree id="n15030" type="main" key="Ea^ri^nus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eărĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nos</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(earino/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, cited as an example of <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license, and scanned Ēăr-, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:2:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eatenus: <entryFree id="n15031" type="main" key="e^a_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕā-tĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>is</etym>, designates the limit to which an action or condition extends, <sense id="n15031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so far</hi> (rare; perh. not before Cic., for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 50</bibl>, the right reading is protenus); followed by <hi rend="ital">quatenus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:92" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules lactucae ab imo depurgatos eatenus, qua tenera folia videbuntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; followed by <hi rend="ital">qua</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">quoad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc civile, quod vocant, eatenus exercuerunt, quoad populum praestare voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 11</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to that extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba persequens eatenus, ut ea non abhorreant a more nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl>.—Cf. with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15031.1" n="II" level="1"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">so long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hitherto</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gordian. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ebeneus: <entryFree id="n15032" type="main" key="e^be^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbĕnĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hĕb-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hebenus, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n15032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ebony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ebon</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Capt. 1:section=80" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Capt. 1, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ebeninus: <entryFree id="n15033" type="greek" key="e^be^ni^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbĕnĭnus</orth>, v. hebeninus.</entryFree>
ebenus: <entryFree id="n15034" type="greek" key="e^be^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbĕnus</orth>, v. hebenus.</entryFree>
ebibo: <entryFree id="n15035" type="main" key="e_bi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>bi, bĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi> (not in Cic. or Caes.). </sense><sense id="n15035.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid comedent? quid ebibent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with comedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hirneam vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera lactantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 342</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos dracones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to suck their blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 12, 12, § 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vino simitu imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>to drink up</tr>, <tr>forget through drinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 84</bibl></cit> (cf. in the <hi rend="ital">simplex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>, v. bibo).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: invenies illic, qui Nestoris ebibat annos, <hi rend="ital">to drink the age of Nestor</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">to drink as many glasses as equal the years of Nestor</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:533" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 533</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15035.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to suck in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absorb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fretum) peregrinos amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 837</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saniem (lana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:38:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 38, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15035.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to waste in drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 122</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15035.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exhaust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum meum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ebiscum: <entryFree id="n15036" type="main" key="e^biscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbiscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = hibiscum, q. v. Scribon. 80 and 82.</entryFree>
ebito: <entryFree id="n15037" type="spur" key="e_bi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbīto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 28</bibl>, for bitat, v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
eblandior: <entryFree id="n15038" type="main" key="e_blandi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-blandĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n15038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obtain by flattery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coaxing</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">enitere, elabora vel potius eblandire, effice, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit> C, § 12; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum consulatus diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudinem ruris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15038.1" n="II" level="1"> Of inanimate subjects, <hi rend="ital">to foster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mature by mildness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo fecunditatem omnem eblandito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 51, § 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl>; and somewhat diferently: ut eblandiatur lac igneam saevitiam,<pb n="623" /> <cb n="EBUL" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">mitigate and drive it out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>.!*? <mood>Part.</mood>, eblandītus, a, um, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtained</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caught by flattery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eblandita suffragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:70" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ebora: <entryFree id="n15039" type="main" key="Ebo^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n15039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A castle in Spain</hi>, perh. the present <hi rend="ital">Ixar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 4, 2</bibl>: ex conjec. Turneb. (Bait. Baream).—</sense><sense id="n15039.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A municipium in Lusitania</hi>, also called Libertas Julia, now <hi rend="ital">Ebora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eboracum: <entryFree id="n15040" type="main" key="Ebora_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eborācum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of the Brigantes in Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">York</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 190 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eborarius: <entryFree id="n15041" type="main" key="e^bo^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbŏrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ebŭr-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ebur</etym>, <sense id="n15041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worker in ivory</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>; Inscr. Orell, 4180; 4302.</sense></entryFree>
eboreus: <entryFree id="n15042" type="main" key="e^bo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, am</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of ivory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ivory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 61</bibl></cit> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
ebriacus: <entryFree id="n15043" type="hapax" key="e_bri^a_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ebrius; cf. merācus, from merus</etym>, <sense id="n15043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drunken</hi>: homo, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 7</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. v. 10</bibl>) dub.</sense></entryFree>
ebriamen: <entryFree id="n15044" type="hapax" key="e_bri^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ebrio</etym>, <sense id="n15044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intoxicating liquor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong drink</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Jejun. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ebrietas: <entryFree id="n15045" type="main" key="e_bri^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ebrius</etym>, <sense id="n15045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drunkenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ebriety</hi> (cf.: ebriositas, crapula), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:16 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 142</bibl>: in proelia trudit inermem, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:20:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 20, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carouses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> § 16. —</sense><sense id="n15045.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio liquore abundat rumpitque se pomi ipsius ebrietas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>excess of juice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ebrio: <entryFree id="n15046" type="main" key="e_bri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intoxicate</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n15046.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15046.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ebriolatus: <entryFree id="n15047" type="hapax" key="e_bri^o^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ebriolus</etym>, <sense id="n15047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little intoxicated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather tipsy</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ebriolus: <entryFree id="n15048" type="main" key="e_bri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n15048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [ebrius], <hi rend="ital">a little intoxicated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather tipsy</hi>, perh. only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ebriositas: <entryFree id="n15049" type="hapax" key="e_bri^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ebriosus</etym>, <sense id="n15049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">addiction to drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sottishness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ebriosus: <entryFree id="n15050" type="main" key="e_bri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ebrius</etym>, <sense id="n15050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given to drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">addicted to drunkenness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15050.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc scribunt ebriosum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum interesse inter ebrium et ebriosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 11</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a drunkard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla ebriosorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:145 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 51, § 145 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15050.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">acina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>full of juice</tr>, <tr>juicy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ebrius: <entryFree id="n15051" type="main" key="e_bri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. root <foreign lang="greek">frh/n</foreign>; cf. sobrius</etym>, <sense id="n15051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">who has drunk enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">had his fill</hi>, corresp. with satur. </sense><sense id="n15051.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu satura atque ebria eris, puer ut satur sit facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saturitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n15051.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">full of drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi> (cf. also: <cit><quote lang="la">potus, ebriosus, temulentus, vinolentus): homo hic ebrius est ... Tu istic, ubi bibisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 19</bibl>, sq. al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 18</bibl> (thrice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:582" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 582</bibl>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ebrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a drunkard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:106:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 106, 27</bibl>; id. Job, 12, 25 al. et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15051.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 48</bibl></cit> (4, 2, 48 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:47" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bruma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15051.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrius jam sanguine civium et tanto magis eum sitiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina fortuna dulci ebria,</quote> <trans><tr>intoxicated with good fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis pueri ebrios ocellos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>intoxicated with love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebria de sanguine sanctorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15051.5" n="III" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">abundantly filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana de sanguine conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:154" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 154</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ebromagus: <entryFree id="n15052" type="main" key="Ebromagus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebromagus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in the province of Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bram</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl> Halm (Kayser, Cobiamachus, § 19).</sense></entryFree>
ebulinus: <entryFree id="n15053" type="main" key="e^bu^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ebulum</etym>, <sense id="n15053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of elder-wood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 64</bibl>. <cb n="ECBA" /></sense></entryFree>
ebullio: <entryFree id="n15054" type="main" key="e_bulli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-bullĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype> (and post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbullo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, 1), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n15054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15054.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bubble up</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n15054.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontium venae ebullant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Pall. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15054.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come forth bubbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear boisterously</hi>: dum risus ebullit <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">o si Ebullit patrui praeclarum funus! i. e. utinam patruus moriatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> Dübner: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam hujus monstri idoli artifices ebullissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Perside,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurry confusedly away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Mac. 1, 12.—</sense><sense id="n15054.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (class., but rare). </sense><sense id="n15054.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to breathe out</tr>, <tr>give up the ghost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15054.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To produce in abundance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ebulliet fluvius ranas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">os fatuorum ebullit stultitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to boast of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 42</bibl></cit> Kühn; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 80</bibl> (and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pafla/zein</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
ebullitio: <entryFree id="n15055" type="main" key="e_bulli_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēbullītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ebullio</etym>, <sense id="n15055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bubbling up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>: scintillantis olei, Mythogr. Lat. 1, 231 <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ebulum: <entryFree id="n15056" type="main" key="e^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Dane-wort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwarf-elder</hi>: Sambucus ebulus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:37:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:119 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 73, § 119 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 27</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 10 al.</sense></entryFree>
ebur: <entryFree id="n15057" type="main" key="e^bur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbur</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:22 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 22 sq.</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Copt. ebu; cf. Sanscr. ibhas, elephant; whence Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)le/fas</foreign>, Semit. article el being prefixed</etym>, <sense id="n15057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ivory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15057.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 96</bibl> et saep.—Prov.: ebur atramento candefacere, v. atramentum.—</sense><sense id="n15057.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15057.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Things made of ivory.</hi> So of statues, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 792</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 193</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a scabbard,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 148</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the sella curulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 5, 18</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n15057.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An elephant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eburarius: <entryFree id="n15058" type="main" key="e^bu^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbŭrārĭus</orth>, v. eborarius.</entryFree>
eburatus: <entryFree id="n15059" type="main" key="e^bu^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbŭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ebur</etym>, <sense id="n15059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inlaid with ivory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
eburini: <entryFree id="n15060" type="main" key="Eburi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eburīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lucania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 98</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eburī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 67</bibl></cit> Dietsch; p. 222 ed. Gerl. min.</sense></entryFree>
eburneolus: <entryFree id="n15061" type="hapax" key="e^burne^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕburnĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n15061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [eburneus], <hi rend="ital">of ivory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 225</bibl></cit> (for which, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 16</bibl>, eburnea).</sense></entryFree>
eburneus: <entryFree id="n15062" type="main" key="e^burne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕburnĕus</orth>, <itype>and</itype> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕbur-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ebur</etym>, <sense id="n15062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ivory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15062.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">eburneus</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 354</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl></cit> al.; so, tulit eburneos dentes mille, etc., <hi rend="ital">ivory tusks</hi>, i. e. elephants' tusks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 59, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15062.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ebur-nus</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">humerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 699</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 178</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 103 al.: ensis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with an ivory hilt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15062.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">white as ivory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15062.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">eburne-us</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburnea brachia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so, cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 422</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:592" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 592</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15062.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ebur-nus</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">digiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eburobrittium: <entryFree id="n15063" type="main" key="Ebu^ro^britti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebŭrŏbrittĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-britĭum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eburones: <entryFree id="n15064" type="main" key="Eburo_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eburōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nation of</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">extending from Liege to Aix-laChapelle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 24</bibl> sq.; 6, 31 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eburovices: <entryFree id="n15065" type="main" key="Ebu_ro^vi_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebūrŏvīces</orth>, v. Aulerci.</entryFree>
ebusus: <entryFree id="n15066" type="main" key="Ebu^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebŭsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebŭsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Mediterranean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the coast of Spain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Iviza</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Yvica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:363" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 363</bibl>; Mela, 2, 7, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 19, 21, § 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 368</bibl>.—Scanned Ebūsus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 621</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebōsīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ebusitā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Ebusus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 76</bibl>: humus, Mela, 2, 7, 22.</sense></entryFree>
ecastor: <entryFree id="n15067" type="main" key="e_castor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēcastor</orth>, v 2. Castor.</entryFree>
ecaudis: <entryFree id="n15068" type="main" key="e_caudis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēcaudis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>e-cauda</etym>, <sense id="n15068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a tail</hi>, only trop.: versus = <foreign lang="greek">mei/ouroi</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">ska/zontes</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 499</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
ecbasis: <entryFree id="n15069" type="greek" key="ecba^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecbăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kbasis</foreign>, pure Lat. digressio, <sense id="n15069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digression</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 209</bibl> <cb n="ECCE" /></sense></entryFree>
ecbatana: <entryFree id="n15070" type="main" key="Ecba^ta^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ecbătăna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *)ekba/tana</foreign> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ecbătăna</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 533, 30</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ecbătănae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, App. de Mundo, p. 69, 18), <sense id="n15070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the principal city of Media</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Hamadan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:1" default="NO">5, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ecbolas: <entryFree id="n15071" type="greek" key="ecbo^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecbŏlas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kbola/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of Egyptian grape</hi> (so called from its promoting abortion), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecca: <entryFree id="n15072" type="main" key="ecca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecca</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eccam</orth>, v. ecce, II. D.</entryFree>
ecce: <entryFree id="n15073" type="main" key="ecce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecce</orth>, <sense id="n15073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. demonstr.</hi> [perh. from locat. form of pronom. stem i, with demonstr. ending -ce; hence, in comedy often scanned ĕce, Corss. Aussp. 2, 636, 1026 sq. —Ribbeck explains ecce as indef. form ec, as in ecquis, ecquando, etc., strengthened by demonstr. ce, Lat. Part. p. 42 sq.; and Curt. refers it to root oc- of oculus; cf. eccere, Gr. Etym. p. 457], points out an object with emphasis, <hi rend="ital">lo! see! behold!</hi> (constr. class. with <case>nom.</case> or <hi rend="ital">clause</hi>, and ante-class. also with <case>acc.</case>). </sense><sense id="n15073.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quaero, optime ecce obviam mihi est,</quote> <trans><tr>behold! there comes he I was wishing for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem video rure redeuntem senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce Dionaei processit Caesaris astrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce trahebatur passis Priameïa virgo Crinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 403</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:441 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 441 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">sometimes in the middle of a clause: audiat haec tantum—vel qui venit ecce Palaemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparet adhuc vetus cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:444" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 444</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ec. 1, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15073.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15073.3" n="A" level="2"> To denote that something is present (cf. Fr. <hi rend="ital">voici</hi>), <hi rend="ital">here</hi> (in this sense mostly ellipt.): circus noster ecce adest, Plaut Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">so with adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 496</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me quaeris? ... ecce me,</quote> <trans><tr>here I am</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ecce me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce odium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce Gripi scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce tuae litterae de Varrone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce hominem te, Stasime, nihili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply ecce,</quote> <trans><tr>here I am</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15073.4" n="B" level="2"> In enumerations, or after other objects mentioned, to introduce a new one with emphasis (Ciceronian): consecuti sunt hos Critias, Theramenes, Lysias, etc. ... ecce tibi exortus est Isocrates, Cic de Or. 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so ellipt.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15073.5" n="C" level="2"> To introduce something unexpected or strange; hence, sometimes connected with <hi rend="ital">subito</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repente</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de improviso</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce Apollo mihi ex oraculo imperat, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 41, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl>: et ecce de improviso ad nos accedit cana veritas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 243, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discubitum noctu ut imus, ecce ad me advenit mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>; so with a preceding <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 20</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dum agit, ecce, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 60</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 219</bibl>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce postridie Cassio litterae Capua a Lucretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">subito</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; and with a preceding <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— For the expression ecce autem, v. autem. —</sense><sense id="n15073.6" n="D" level="2"> In conversat. lang., combined with the pronouns is, ille, and iste, into one word standing for either the simple ecce, or the pronoun itself, but with demonstrative force, in the foll. forms: <case>nom.</case>, ecca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eccilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eccillud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi>, eccum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 22</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 48</bibl> et saep.; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 177</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">eccam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 15</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eccillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and syncopated ellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eccillam, and sync. ellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 194</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">eccistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <number>plur.</number>, eccos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 15</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 95</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">eccas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 110</bibl></cit>. <pb n="624" /> <cb n="ECHI" /> —On the construction of eccum, etc., cf. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1002, p. 72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1002, p. 72</bibl>; and on ecce see Hand, Turs. II. pp. 343-351.</sense></entryFree>
eccentros: <entryFree id="n15074" type="greek" key="eccentros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eccentros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kkentros</foreign>, <sense id="n15074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out of the centre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eccentric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 849 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
eccere: <entryFree id="n15075" type="main" key="ecce^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eccĕre</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕcĕre</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos> <etym>ecce and abl. of res, <hi rend="ital">see there in fact! lo in truth!</hi> Corss. Aussp. 2, 858, 1028; cf. Ribbeck, Partik., p. 43 sq.; not from Ceres, but cf. Ussing ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 550</bibl></etym>, an exclamation of surprise, like Engl. <sense id="n15075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">there!</hi> (emphatic, only in the foll. passages): <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Casin. 2, 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 2, 5</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 52</bibl>: ecce autem, Fleck. Lorenz).</sense></entryFree>
eccheuma: <entryFree id="n15076" type="greek" key="eccheuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eccheuma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kxeuma</foreign>, <sense id="n15076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eccillam: <entryFree id="n15077" type="main" key="eccillam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eccillam, eccillum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eccistam</orth>, v. ecce, II. D.</entryFree>
ecclesia: <entryFree id="n15078" type="greek" key="eccle_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecclēsĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ēcclĕsĭa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 358</bibl>; Venant. Carm. 3, 6, 24; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕclĕsĭa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 15, 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 32</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kklhsi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assembly of the</hi> (Greek) <hi rend="ital">people.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15078.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: et ecclesia consentiente, <hi rend="ital">senate and people</hi>, in the free cities of Greece: bule et ecclesia, Plin. et Traj. Ep. 111, 1. —</sense><sense id="n15078.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15078.3" n="A" level="2"> In eccl. Lat. </sense><sense id="n15078.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A religious assembly of Christians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Christian congregation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a church</hi> (eccl. Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq.): die ecclesiae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:18:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 18, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,018:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Philem. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 190:5:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 190, 5, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15078.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Church</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole body of believers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus dilexit ecclesiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 137:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 137, 6</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in coelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 12, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15078.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Christian place of assembly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a church</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nomine ecclesiae, id est populi qui continetur, significamus locum qui continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 190:5:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 190, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n15078.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An assembly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a meeting</hi> in gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecclesiastes: <entryFree id="n15079" type="greek" key="Eccle_si^astes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ecclēsĭastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kklhsiasth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Preacher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15079.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius David,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Solomon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15079.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">Ecclesiastes</hi>, a book of the Old Testament, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecclesiasticus: <entryFree id="n15080" type="greek" key="eccle_si^asti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecclēsĭastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kklhsiastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Church</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ecclesiastical.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15080.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15080.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecclesiasticus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n15080.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A church officer</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 3, 22.—</sense><sense id="n15080.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of the Book of Sirach</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 2, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecclesiecdicus: <entryFree id="n15081" type="greek" key="eccle_si^ecdi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecclēsĭecdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kklhsiekdiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a church proctor</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 5, 34, 5.</sense></entryFree>
ecclesiola: <entryFree id="n15082" type="main" key="eccle_si^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecclēsĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ecclesia</etym>, <sense id="n15082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small church</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 39, 71 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eccum: <entryFree id="n15083" type="main" key="eccum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eccum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eccos</orth>, v. ecce, II. D.</entryFree>
ecdicus: <entryFree id="n15084" type="greek" key="ecdi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kdiko/s</foreign>, i. q. cognitor or defensor civitatis, <sense id="n15084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a syndic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitor of a community</hi> (esp. in Asia Minor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 1</bibl> and 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:111:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 111, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecere: <entryFree id="n15085" type="main" key="e^ce^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕcĕre</orth>, v. eccere.</entryFree>
ecetra: <entryFree id="n15086" type="main" key="Ece^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ecĕtra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)exe/tra</foreign>, <sense id="n15086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Volsci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 61, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 31</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> are <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ecĕtrāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)exe/tranoi</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 4, 2</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
ecfatus: <entryFree id="n15087" type="main" key="ecfa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecfātus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ecfĕro</orth>, etc., v. eff-.</entryFree>
echea: <entryFree id="n15088" type="greek" key="e_che_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēchēa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)xei=a</foreign>, <sense id="n15088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vessels to increase the sound of the actors' voices in a theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sounding-vessels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl> (1, 1, 9 written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
echecrates: <entryFree id="n15089" type="main" key="Echecra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Echecrătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)exekra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n15089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pythagorean philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Plato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echeneis: <entryFree id="n15090" type="greek" key="e^che^ne_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchĕnēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)xenhi+/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sucking-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remora</hi>, Echeneis remora, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 1, 1, § 2</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 675</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:99" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 6, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echidna: <entryFree id="n15091" type="greek" key="e^chidna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchidna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/xidna</foreign>, <sense id="n15091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viper.</hi> The Furies were said to have them twined in their hair; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: stipite te Stygio tumidisque adflavit Echidnis E tribus una soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 313</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15091.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Nom. prop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15091.2" n="A" level="2"> Lernaea, <hi rend="ital">the Lernaean hydra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:405" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 405</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15091.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A monster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half woman and half serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of Cerberus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 501</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Echidnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Echidna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cerberus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 408</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
echinades: <entryFree id="n15092" type="main" key="E^chi_na^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕchīnădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)exina/des</foreign>, <sense id="n15092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="ECLI" /> <hi rend="ital">small group of islands in the Ionian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the mouth of the Acheloüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 85, 87, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 19, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 589</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echinatus: <entryFree id="n15093" type="main" key="e^chi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>echinus, a hedge-hog</etym>, <sense id="n15093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set with prickles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitula echinata spinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 47, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 9, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
echinometrae: <entryFree id="n15094" type="greek" key="e^chi_no^me_trae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchīnŏmētrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)xinomh=trai</foreign>, <sense id="n15094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of sea-urchin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echinophora: <entryFree id="n15095" type="greek" key="e^chi_no^pho^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchīnŏphŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)xinofo/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n15095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of</hi> concha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl> (Sillig, actinophoroe).</sense></entryFree>
echinopus: <entryFree id="n15096" type="greek" key="e^chi_no^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchīnŏpūs</orth>, <itype>ŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)xino/pous</foreign>, <sense id="n15096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echinus: <entryFree id="n15097" type="greek" key="e^chi_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)xi=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n15097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hedgehog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urchin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15097.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., usually the (edible) <hi rend="ital">sea-urchin</hi>, Echinus esculentus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl> Müll.; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 216, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:100 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 100 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The land-urchin</hi> (otherwise called erinaceus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 2, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 6, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15097.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things having a similar shape. </sense><sense id="n15097.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A copper vessel for the table</hi>, perh. to wash out the cups in, <hi rend="ital">a rinsing-bowl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 117</bibl>, v. Heindorf, ad h. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15097.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The prickly husk of a chestnut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:83" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15097.5" n="C" level="2"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">an ornament under the chapiter of a Doric or Ionic column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an echinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 3</bibl>; cf. Müller, Archaeol. § 277.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15098" type="main" key="E^chi_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕchīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)exi=nos</foreign>. <sense id="n15098.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Phthiotis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 14, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15098.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Acarnania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echion: <entryFree id="n15099" type="main" key="e^chi^on1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/xion</foreign>, <sense id="n15099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicament prepared from the ashes of adders</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15100" type="main" key="E^chi_on2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕchīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n15100.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the heroes who sprang up from the dragon's teeth sown by Cadmus; the husband of Agave and father of Pentheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 686</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:569" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 569</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 178" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 178</bibl>.—Hence: Echione natus, for <hi rend="ital">Pentheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 526</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15100.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n15100.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Echīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Echion</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pentheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 513</bibl> and 701.—</sense><sense id="n15100.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Echīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, meton. for <hi rend="ital">Cadmean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydrus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>killed by Cadmus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:343" default="NO"><author>Val.
