Fl.</author> 8, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:554" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:301" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 301</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 515</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:169" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15100.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Mercury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an Argonaut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a sharer in the Calydonian hunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15100.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Echīŏ-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Echion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 345</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15100.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Greek painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echios: <entryFree id="n15101" type="greek" key="e^chi^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchĭos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/xios</foreign>, <sense id="n15101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">viper's bugloss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant which was taken as a remedy for the viper's bite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 58, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echis: <entryFree id="n15102" type="greek" key="e^chis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also pseudoanchusa, and doris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 20, 24, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echite: <entryFree id="n15103" type="greek" key="echi_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">echīte</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)xi/th</foreign>, <sense id="n15103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> clematis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 89, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echitis: <entryFree id="n15104" type="greek" key="e^chi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕchītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)xi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n15104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adder-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echo: <entryFree id="n15105" type="greek" key="e_cho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēcho</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)xw/</foreign>, <sense id="n15105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">repercussion of sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">echo</hi> (pure Lat. imago), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:102" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 297</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 18</bibl>.—Personified as a nymph, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:358 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 358 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">99, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
echoicus: <entryFree id="n15106" type="greek" key="e_cho_i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēchōĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)xwi+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">echoing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: metrum, <hi rend="ital">in which one or more final syllables echo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhyme to a preceding part of the verse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1826</bibl> P. (cf. Burm. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, p. 558</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ecligma: <entryFree id="n15107" type="greek" key="ecli_gma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eclīgma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kleigma</foreign>, <sense id="n15107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine to be taken by letting it melt in the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an electuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 7, 23, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:110" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 35, § 110</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecligmătĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <hi rend="ital">dim. n.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eclipsis: <entryFree id="n15108" type="greek" key="ecli_psis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eclīpsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kleiyis</foreign> (a forsaking, being absent): <sense id="n15108.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <trans><tr>an eclipse of the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 22, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; and without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 53</bibl> (pure Lat. defectio and defectus). <cb n="ECQU" /></sense></entryFree>
eclipticus: <entryFree id="n15109" type="greek" key="eclipti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecliptĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kleiptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to an eclipse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 816</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">846</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 68</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">linea,</quote> <trans><tr>the ecliptic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 216</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ecloga: <entryFree id="n15110" type="greek" key="eclo^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eclŏga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)klogh/</foreign>, <sense id="n15110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a selection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of the finest passages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from a written composition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15110.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: eclogas ex Annali descriptas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 97</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n15110.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a short poem of any kind</hi>, like the poems in the Sylvae of Statius; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl> praef.; the Idyls of Ausonius; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10 praef.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the Odes of Horace,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit> praef., and in many MSS. of Horace; and in the grammarians the Bucolica of Vergil are also called Eclogae, <hi rend="ital">Eclogues;</hi> cf. Heyne de Carm. Bucol. in Verg. Opp. ed. Wagn. I. p. 18.</sense></entryFree>
eclogarius: <entryFree id="n15111" type="main" key="eclo^ga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eclŏgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ecloga</etym>, <sense id="n15111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a selection;</hi> only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15111.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">eclŏgārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a collection of selected poems</hi>, the title of a book of Ausonius, Weber, Corp. <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> Lat. pp. 1254 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n15111.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">eclŏgārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, sc. libri, = eclogae, <hi rend="ital">select passages from a work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ecnephias: <entryFree id="n15112" type="greek" key="ecne^phi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecnĕphĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)knefi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n15112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hurricane supposed to be produced by blasts from two opposite clouds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 48, 49, § 131</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 12</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
econtra: <entryFree id="n15113" type="main" key="e_contra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēcontra</orth> = contra, q. v. I. E. 4.</entryFree>
ecphora: <entryFree id="n15114" type="greek" key="ecpho^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecphŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kfora/</foreign>, <sense id="n15114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a projection in buildings</hi> (pure Lat. projectura), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecpyrosis: <entryFree id="n15115" type="greek" key="ecpy_ro_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecpȳrōsis</orth>, <itype>eos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kpu/rwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n15115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning utterly</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. Ecl. 4, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecquando: <entryFree id="n15116" type="main" key="ecquando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecquando</orth>, <sense id="n15116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. interrog.</hi> [ec, cf. ecce, and quando], <hi rend="ital">ever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at any time;</hi> in a passionate (esp. indignant) interrogation (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ecquando te rationem factorum tuorum redditurum putasti? ecquando his de rebus tales viros audituros existimasti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 26</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 3, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:395" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 395</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi> (= num unquam ... nisi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15116.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With interrog particle <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> suffixed (pleonastic): <cit><quote lang="la">ecquandone tibi liber sum visus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl> Ruhnk.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 290</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 63</bibl> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ecqui: <entryFree id="n15117" type="main" key="ecqui1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecqui</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ecquae</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecqua</orth> (cf. Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 25</bibl>, and v. aliqui), <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecquod</orth> (<sense id="n15117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> is not in use), <hi rend="ital">pron. interr. adj.</hi> [ec, cf. ecce, and qui], <hi rend="ital">Is there any one who? Any?</hi> in impassioned interrogation, i. q. num qui, quae (qua) quod. </sense><sense id="n15117.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (with a <hi rend="ital">subst.;</hi> class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ecqui pudor est? ecquae religio, Verres? ecqui metus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 341</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: ecqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (thrice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:341 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 341 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus Sunii ecquod haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ecquod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:3 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquem trapezitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ecquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 7 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 6</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ecquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 56 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecqui silices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—With suffixed <hi rend="ital">nam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecquaenam origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquodnam curriculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquonam modo, ecquonam loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 14</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15117.2" n="II" level="1"> Without a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis cenā poscit? ecqui poscit prandio?</quote> <trans><tr>Does any one bid a breakfast?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n15118" type="main" key="ecqui2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecqui</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>; see the foll. art. II. B.</entryFree>
ecquis: <entryFree id="n15119" type="main" key="ecquis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecquis</orth>, <itype>ecquid</itype> (<case>abl.</case> ecqui, <sense id="n15119.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">pron. interrog. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Is there any one who? Any</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing?</hi> in impassioned interrogation, i. q. num quis, quid (class.). </sense><sense id="n15119.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aperite hoc: heus, ecquis hic est? ecquis hoc aperit ostium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 9 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 99</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 34 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40 al.</bibl>: <pb n="625" /> <cb n="EDEN" /> eccui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; Cael. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15</bibl> et saep.— With suffix <hi rend="ital">nam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid huc tantum hominum incedunt? ecquidnam afferunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15119.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> for ecqui: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis alius Sosia intu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 226</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15119.3" n="II" level="1"> Hence, derivv. the adverbs, </sense><sense id="n15119.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecquid</orth>, i. q. numquid, num, <hi rend="ital">whether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perchance</hi>, in direct and indirect interrogation: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid audis?</quote> <trans><tr>Do you hear?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 53 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 342</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 82</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with tandem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Ecquid placent (aedes)? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Ecquid placeant me rogas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 27</bibl>.—Rarely (like quid) for cur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 26</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n15119.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecqui</orth>, i. q. num aliqui, <hi rend="ital">whether?</hi> in indirect interrog.: coepi observare, ecqui majorem filius mi honorem haberet, etc., <hi rend="ital">whether</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 16</bibl> (but the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 4, 2</bibl>, is ecquid, v. Draeger, Hist Synt. I. p. 318).—</sense><sense id="n15119.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ec-quo</orth>, i. q. num aliquo, <hi rend="ital">anywhere?</hi> ecquo te tua virtus provexisset? ecquo industria? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 24</bibl>, cf. on these adverbs Hand, Turs. II. pp. 351-355.</sense></entryFree>
ecquisnam: <entryFree id="n15120" type="main" key="ecquisnam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecquisnam</orth>, v. ecquis, I. <sense id="n15120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ecquo: <entryFree id="n15121" type="main" key="ecquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecquo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ecquis, II. C.</entryFree>
ecragino: <entryFree id="n15122" type="main" key="ecra_gi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecrāgīno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)kragh=nai</foreign>, <sense id="n15122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break forth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecstasis: <entryFree id="n15123" type="greek" key="ecsta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecstăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kstasis</foreign>, <sense id="n15123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being beside one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ecstasy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapture</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 45 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ectasis: <entryFree id="n15124" type="main" key="ecta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ectăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (acc. -in), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/ktasis</foreign>, <sense id="n15124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lengthening of a vowel short by nature: si</hi> brevis est per naturam, sed hoc loco ectasin fecit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ecthlipsis: <entryFree id="n15125" type="greek" key="ecthlipsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ecthlipsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kqliyis</foreign>, gram. t. t., <sense id="n15125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ecthlipsis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the elision of a final m with its vowel before an initial vowel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 2, p. 436</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 4, p. 249</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ectomon: <entryFree id="n15126" type="greek" key="ecto^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ectŏmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/ktomon</foreign>, <sense id="n15126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black hellebore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ectroma: <entryFree id="n15127" type="greek" key="ectro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ectrōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/ktrwma</foreign>, <sense id="n15127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abortion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ectropa: <entryFree id="n15128" type="greek" key="ectro^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ectrŏpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ktroph/</foreign>, i. q. deversorium, <sense id="n15128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inn</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ectypus: <entryFree id="n15129" type="greek" key="ecty^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ectypus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/ktupos</foreign>, <sense id="n15129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">engraved in relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embossed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imago eminente gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eculeus: <entryFree id="n15130" type="main" key="e^cu^leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕcŭleus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. equuleus.</entryFree>
edacitas: <entryFree id="n15131" type="main" key="e^da_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>edax</etym>, <sense id="n15131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">voracity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Luc. 7, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edax:
<entryFree id="n15132" type="main" key="e^dax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. edo; cf. Sanscr. adakas</etym>, <sense id="n15132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">voracious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluttonous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15132.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl> (<case>abl.</case> edaci, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 354</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:420" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 420</bibl> et saep.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultur,</quote> <trans><tr>rapacious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edacissima animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 60:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 60, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15132.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of inanimate and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">devouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 758</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:785" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 785</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:872" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 872</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <trans><tr>gnawing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 18</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense>
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">edeatroe</orth>, <itype>qui praesunt regiis epulis</itype>, dicti <foreign lang="greek">a)po\ tw=n e)desma/twn</foreign>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 20</bibl> Müll. [<foreign lang="greek">e)de/atroi</foreign>, seneschals of the table, carvers, v. Lidd. and Scott s. v.].</entryFree>
edecimo: <entryFree id="n15133" type="main" key="e_de^ci^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dĕcĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-decumo</orth>), no <sense id="n15133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (to select the tithes; hence, in gen.), <hi rend="ital">to pick out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:81" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:9:21" default="NO">9, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">edecimata</hi> (ex-) electa, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 6</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
edento: <entryFree id="n15134" type="main" key="e_dento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dens</etym>, <sense id="n15134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render toothless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knock out the teeth</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">malas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edentatae beluae morsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edentulus: <entryFree id="n15135" type="main" key="e_dentu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dentŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">toothless.</hi> <cb n="EDIC" /> </sense><sense id="n15135.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vetulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 111</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 305: <cit><quote lang="la">bestia muraena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n15135.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of wine <hi rend="ital">ripened by age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edepol: <entryFree id="n15136" type="main" key="e^de^pol"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdĕpol</orth>, v. Pollux.</entryFree>
edera: <entryFree id="n15137" type="main" key="e^de^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdĕra</orth>, <itype>ae, and its derivatives</itype>, v. hed-.</entryFree>
edessa: <entryFree id="n15138" type="main" key="E^dessa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕdessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/edessa</foreign>. <sense id="n15138.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the burial-place of the kings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 1, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Edes-saeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Edessa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiphilus (dux),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15138.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Mesopotamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the province of</hi> Osrhoëne, now <hi rend="ital">Rhoa</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Orfa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 7, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and where Caracalla died,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 21" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 11</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Edessēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Edessa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edibilis: <entryFree id="n15139" type="main" key="e^di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. edo</etym>, <sense id="n15139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eatable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be taken as food</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edico: <entryFree id="n15140" type="main" key="e_di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (old form, <sense id="n15140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: EXDEICATIS; <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>: EXDEICENDUM, S. C. de Bacchan.; <hi rend="ital">imperat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 463</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:598" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 598</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15140.1" n="I" level="1"> A t. t. of magistrates, <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi> a decree, ordinance, etc.; hence, <hi rend="ital">to establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi> by proclamation (cf.: praecipio, mando, jubeo). </sense><sense id="n15140.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem edicere, ut senatus senatusconsulto ne obtemperet ... edicere est ausus, ut senatus ad vestitum rediret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9 al.</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">abl. part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicto, ut and ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 7, 2</bibl>; and with a <hi rend="ital">simple subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tribuni plebis edixissent, senatus adesset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 258</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 235</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non proscriptā neque edictā die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dies edicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem comitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 49</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem exercitui ad conveniendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia a. d. XI. Kal. Febr.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum in diem posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventum sociis Tarraconem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novemdiale sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicationem populo in diem unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam omnem militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit> et saep.—With an <hi rend="ital">obj. acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edixit, sese judicium injuriarum non daturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 27</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Vitellius de caerimoniis publicis edixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de natali suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de iisdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15140.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of the praetor, <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, on entering upon his office, the principles on which he intends to administer it: <cit><quote lang="la">est tibi edicendum quae sis observaturus in jure dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 74</bibl></cit>; v. edictum.</sense><sense id="n15140.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in gen., <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dectare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi> any thing (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu scire possis, edico tibi: Si falsa dices, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 23</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:227 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 227 al.</bibl>—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico, edico vobis, nostrum esse illum erilem filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">nullus fere ab eo (sc. Demosthene) locus sine quadam conformatione sententiae edicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussus a consule, quae sciret edicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to discover</tr>, <tr>communicate</tr>, <tr>give notice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 4</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">si prius, quid maxime reprehendere Scipio solitus sit, edixero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc simul edixi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiens stabulis edico in mollibus herbam Carpere oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 295</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 463</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:313" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:528" default="NO">528</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem remittere edixit (rex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15140.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpret</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sensum hujus sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edictalis: <entryFree id="n15141" type="main" key="e_dicta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdictālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>edictum</etym>, <sense id="n15141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by edict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to edict</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">possessio bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 6, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">programma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the imperial edict</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edictio: <entryFree id="n15142" type="main" key="e_dicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>edico</etym>, <sense id="n15142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edict</hi>, for the usual edictum; only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edicto: <entryFree id="n15143" type="main" key="e_dicto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdicto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to speak out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi> (only in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">tute edictas facta tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 184</bibl></cit>: aliquid<cb n="EDIS" />  alicui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edictum: <entryFree id="n15144" type="main" key="e_dictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n15144.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A proclamation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifesto</hi> of the Roman magistrates (cf.: senatus consultum, scitum, jussum; <cit><quote lang="la">decretum, epistola, rescriptum), e. g. of the ediles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a tribune of the people,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a dictator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the consuls,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the proconsuls,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Caesar in the civil war,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the emperor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 1</bibl> (cf. decretum, epistola, rescriptum) et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15144.1" n="2" level="3"> Esp. freq. the public announcement of the praetor, in which he states, on entering upon his office, the rules by which he will be guided in administering justice (out of such legal regulations renewed and made more complete every year—edictum perpetuum, in contradistinction to edicta prout res incidit; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 17</bibl>—there was gradually formed an important part of the body of Roman law), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 67</bibl> et saep.; cf. Sanders, Just. Inst. introd. p. xviii. sq.; xxiv. sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; Rein's Privatr. p. 70 sq.; 80; 83, and the sources cited.—</sense><sense id="n15144.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n15144.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15144.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A play-bill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order of games</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum et ladorum ordinem perlegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his mane edictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:134" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 134</bibl></cit> Gildersleeve ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
edisco: <entryFree id="n15145" type="main" key="e_disco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-disco</orth>, <itype>dĭdĭci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to learn by heart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit to memory</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15145.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non legantur modo (poetae) sed etiam ediscantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec discenda, imo ediscenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenem in primis legendum vel ediscendum potius putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad verbum ediscendus libellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: Lepta ediscat Hesiodum et habeat in ore <foreign lang="greek">*th=s d) a)reth=s i(drw=ta</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: magnum numerum versuum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta clarorum virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:14" default="NO">1, 11, 14</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">De ediscendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, cap. 7, —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:368" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 368</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15145.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study</hi> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, esp. a favorite expression of Ovid): <cit><quote lang="la">qui istam artem (juris) non ediscant (shortly after: si quis aliam artem didicerit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit> ext. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguas duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus pios populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:546" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum (herbarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes paternas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:639" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeros modosque vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 144</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum edidicisset quemadmodum tractandum bellum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edisco tristia posse pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edidici, quid perfida Troia pararet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have experienced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 246</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15145.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edidici,</quote> <trans><tr>I know</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 3, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edissero: <entryFree id="n15146" type="main" key="e_disse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dissĕro</orth>, <itype>rŭi, rtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to analyze in words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam animum advorte ac mihi quae dicam edissere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque necesse est edisseri a nobis quae finis funestae familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum agi, non quemadmodum agantur, edisseri oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laelius eadem edisseruit (for which, shortly before, exposuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctandi utilitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam gerendi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: haec vera roganti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 149</bibl>: tantum hoc, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 306</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnium,</quote> <trans><tr>to interpret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 41, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parabolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 36</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis (Catone) in docendo edisserendoque subtilior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edissertator: <entryFree id="n15147" type="hapax" key="e_disserta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdissertātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>edisserto</etym>, <sense id="n15147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an explainer</hi>: harum rerum, Aus. Sapient. prol. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
edissertio: <entryFree id="n15148" type="hapax" key="e_disserti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdissertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>edissero</etym>, <sense id="n15148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an analysis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scripturarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edisserto: <entryFree id="n15149" type="main" key="e_disserto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-disserto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to analyze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi> (rare, and mostly ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Caes.): ordine omne uti quidque actum'st, Edissertavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1</bibl>, <pb n="626" /> <cb n="EDO" /> p. 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 33</bibl>: neque aggrediar narrare, quae edissertando minora vero fecero, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 54, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
editicius: <entryFree id="n15150" type="main" key="e_di^ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. edo, II. C. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n15150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proposed;</hi> only in the connection, judices, <hi rend="ital">the judges in the</hi> causa sodaliciorum <hi rend="ital">chosen by the plaintiff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
editio: <entryFree id="n15151" type="main" key="e_di^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. edo, II.</etym>. <sense id="n15151.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n15151.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bringing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a birth</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:2:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15151.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A putting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publishing</hi> of a work (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 28</bibl>; Quint. Ep. ad Tryph. § 2; prooem. § 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 15, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15151.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., like our <hi rend="ital">edition</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kdosis</foreign>, qui versus in omni editione invenitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:55" default="NO">12, 10, 55</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15151.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15151.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A statement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15151.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam discrepante editione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15151.7" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designation</hi> of the form of action, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 1 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 39</bibl></cit> and 41, v. 2. edo, II. C. 2., and editicius.—</sense><sense id="n15151.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An exhibition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:50" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muneris gladiatorii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3811</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5020</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
editor: <entryFree id="n15152" type="main" key="e_di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n15152.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which brings forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnae aurae (Volturnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 423</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15152.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to 2. edo, II. D.), <hi rend="ital">an exhibitor</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3762</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
editum: <entryFree id="n15153" type="main" key="e_di^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. edo <sense id="n15153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
editus: <entryFree id="n15154" type="main" key="e_di^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. edo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15155" type="hapax" key="e_di^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. edo</etym>, <sense id="n15155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a voiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excrement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:55:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 55, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edo: <entryFree id="n15156" type="main" key="e^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, ēsum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n15156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—The contr. forms es, est, estis, etc., are very freq. in prose and poetry: <cit><quote lang="la">est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 683</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:136" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:156:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 156, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">estur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 1, 69</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">essetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=106" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 106</bibl></cit> Müll.—Archaic forms of the <hi rend="ital">subj. praes.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>; Caecil. and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:1:56:6" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 1, 56, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57, 9</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">editis, Nov. ap. Non. l. l.: edint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. ad-mi, eat; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/d-w, e)sqi/w</foreign>; Lat. edax, esca, esurio, etc.; cf. also Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)dou/s, o)dont</foreign>- Aeol. <number>plur.</number> <foreign lang="greek">e)dontes</foreign>, dens</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi> (for syn. cf.: comedo, vescor, pascor, devoro, haurio, mando, ceno, epulor). </sense><sense id="n15156.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ille ipse astat, quando edit, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 893</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so uncontr.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserrimus est, qui cum esse cupit, quod edit non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de symbolis essemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergi eos (sc. pullos) in aquam jussit, ut biberent, quoniam esse nollent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15156.2" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n15156.3" n="a" level="4"> Multos modios salis simul edisse, <hi rend="ital">to have eaten bushels of salt with another</hi>, i. e. to be old friends, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15156.4" n="b" level="4"> De patella, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to show contempt for religion</hi> (v. patella), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15156.5" n="c" level="4"> Pugnos, <hi rend="ital">to taste one's fists</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to get a good drubbing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15156.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15156.7" n="1" level="3"> Bona, <hi rend="ital">to squander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 29</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15156.8" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate subjects, qs. <hi rend="ital">to eat up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut mala culmos Esset robigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinas lentus vapor (i. e. flamma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora virus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:608 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 608 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15156.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to corrode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi> (almost exclusively <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est animum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium libenter edi sermonem tuum,</quote> <trans><tr>have devoured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te tantus edat tacitam dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec edunt oblivia laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:665" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 665</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
