<entryFree id="n15157" type="main" key="e_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n15157.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">foras per os est editus aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sputa per fauces tussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: animam, <hi rend="ital">to breathe out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 83</bibl>; Ov. H. <cb n="EDO" /> 9, 62; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum vitae spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to send forth</tr>, <tr>utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">miros risus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitum patulis sub naribus (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1076" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1076</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:444" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinnitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:669" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:451" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 451</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeander in sinum maris editur,</quote> <trans><tr>discharges itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 53</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clanculum ex aedibus me edidi foras,</quote> <trans><tr>have slipped out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n15157.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi> any thing new, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n15157.3" n="A" level="2"> Of what is born, begotten (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">progeniem in oras luminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocodilos dicunt, cum in terra partum ediderint, obruere ova, deinde discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem partu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 660</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 210</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 487</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem maturis nisibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminos Latona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepotem Atlantis (Pleïas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:664 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 664 al.</bibl></cit>: (draconem) Qui luci ediderat genitor Saturnius, idem Abdidit, Cic. Poëta Div. 2, 30, 64; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Electram maximus Atlas Edidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 137</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebetes eduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —More freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: in lucem editus, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl> (a transl. of the Euripid. <foreign lang="greek">to\n fu/nta</foreign>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">editus partu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:517" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 517</bibl></cit>; 9, 678; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Limnate flumine Gange,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: de flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 10</bibl></cit> (cf. Zumpt, Gramm. § <cit><quote lang="la">451): ille hac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 298</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas atavis regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infans ex nepte Julia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15157.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tellus) Edidit innumeras species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 436</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondem ulmus,</quote> <trans><tr>puts forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (sc. academia) praestantissimos in eloquentia viros edidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15157.5" n="B" level="2"> Of literary productions, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de republica libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">librum contra suum doctorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annales suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem scriptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:18" default="NO">3, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:11" default="NO">2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 390</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15157.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi> = exponere; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of the responses of priests and oracles, the decrees of authorities, etc.: apud eosdem (sc. censores) qui magistratu abierint edant et exponant, quid in magistratu gesserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ede illa, quae coeperas, et Bruto et mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 580</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 531</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veros ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor necis editus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:449" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea fata tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 668</bibl></cit> et saep. —With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo Pythius oraculum edidit, Spartam nulla re alia esse perituram, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dupl. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem doctrinae ejus falso Pythagoran edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mihi, quae canerem Titio, deus edidit ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:73" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis editis imperiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:29:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">edito alio tempore ac loco (with constitutum tempus et locus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio in vulgus edita,</quote> <trans><tr>spread abroad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia hostium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to divulge</tr>, <tr>betray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma violentaque bella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sing</tr>, <tr>celebrate in song</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15157.7" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. and polit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promulgate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua quisque actione agere volet, eam prius edere debet. Nam aequissimum videtur, eum, qui acturus est, edere actionem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit> (tit. De edendo), 1 sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 20, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: tribus, said of the plaintiff in a causa sodaliciorum, <hi rend="ital">to name the tribus</hi> (since he had the right, in order to choose the judges, to propose to the defendant four tribus, from which the latter could reject only one, and then to choose the judges according to his own pleasure out of the remaining three, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 15, 36</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">judices editi (= editicii),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Wund. Cic. Planc. p. LXXVI. sq., and see editicius: socium tibi in hujus bonis edidisti Quintium,</quote> <trans><tr>hast mentioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum Apronius edidisset deberi, tantum ex edicto dandum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 42</bibl>: mandata <cb n="EDOL" /> edita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ederet (consul) quid fieri velit,</quote> <trans><tr>to command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15157.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the jurid. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam hanc rationem cordi ventrique edidi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15157.9" n="D" level="2"> Of other objects, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oves nullum fructum edere ex se sine cultu hominum et curatione possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitales motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia pugnasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1010" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1010</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 43 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 45 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 785</bibl></cit> and 527: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum trepidationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus, facinus,</quote> <trans><tr>to perpetrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuam operam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to perform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus gladiatorium (with parare),</quote> <trans><tr>to exhibit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum severitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so more freq.: exempla in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> and 27; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n15157.10" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus celerem super equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:114" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 114</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15157.11" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (set forth, heightened; hence, like excelsus). </sense><sense id="n15157.12" n="A" level="2"> Prop., of places, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">altus, celsus, excelsus, sublimis, procerus, arduus, praeceps, profundus), opp. to flat, level (cf.: collis paululum ex planitie editus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 27</bibl>—very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Henna est loco perexcelso atque edito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 1</bibl> (with acclivis); 7, 18, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:98:3" default="NO" valid="yes">98, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 7, 5</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 28; 31; 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:17 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 17 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n15157.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus editior,</quote> <trans><tr>stronger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 110</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.—</sense><sense id="n15157.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n15157.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in edito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex edito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edita montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 56</bibl>: in editis, Treb. Trig. Tyr. 26.— </sense><sense id="n15157.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 647</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15158" type="hapax" key="e^do3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. edo</etym>, <sense id="n15158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 48, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
